item.title: Evan Escence
item.description:
Infobox Pronounced: "Ehv-en Ess-sen-ss"

Overview



Ran away from home after returning from WuZhia and his arcane studies, Evan never felt like he could accomplish more than his family would allow him

Family Evan's Pet Dog - (deceased) killed by Brand Diodah Urie George Diorissimo Escence - Father Jacqueline Escence - Mother Emelia Escence - Younger Sister Leeland Essence - Younger Brother
Friends Vimack Badger - Traveling Companion Ronpip Thimble-bimble - Traveling Companion Yohan Sheppard - Founder of Dragon's Head Kashoon - Temporary Traveling Companion Hysseld - Hidden Guardian of Dragon's Head
Rivals The Beak - Owner of a Criminal Ring

Born in Vasaaros
At a young age, he was sent off to travel the world, discovering his psionic powers and learning to wield them away from his people with his master Ed Sher'ran
Returned to Arcaedia, though not to his family after some years; tried to avoid the responsibilities that came with being the son of a noble family.
Successes Help solved the first murder of Dragon's Head Stopped the Undead in Massarnae Conversed with a Golden Dragon without being pulled into its Dreamscape Beat his Rival Brand Diodah Urie in a Judgement by Combat. Became the Emperor of Arcaedia and filled the governing void
Critical Wounds Drank of the Time River; Unknown effects. Was shot in the chest by Ronpip Thimble-bimble in reaction to his demonstration of power. Critically Injured by a Revenant; Shortness of breathe as a result from the blow. Critically Injured by an Elven Assassin; another arrow wound permanently scared over. Critically Injured by a summoned skeleton; Permanent scar from a slash across his back.
Possessions Cards

item.title: Lorellai
item.description:
Infobox Pronounced: "-"

Overview Copy

Family
Friends Vimack - Former Traveling Companion Ronpip - Former Traveling Companion Evan - Former Traveling Companion Antilean - Former Traveling Companion
Rivals

Originally from the Plane of Water, Lorellai set out on a personal quest to fulfil her "dream quest", one which had her wander to the Material Plane and wander further still to Vasaaros. There, she met with Vimack Badger, a Giant who befriended a dragon, who further introduced her to the other members of the main party. She helped them complete their main goals in exchange that they would help complete hers.
Truthfully, her goal was to have a special relic given to the right people, ones she thought were heroes, and not to those would would use it for their own selfish goals. And after the Trial of Waters was completed, she returned home with her Mother and Father Water Elementals, back to the Plane of Water.
Perhaps she will once gain be seen, should the party find themselves in need of her once more...

item.title: Antilean Faraday
item.description:
Infobox Pronounced: "Ann-tily-on Farr-ah-day"

Overview



Poor investments and improper marketing pitching led to a total loss and failure of previous mercantile growth.
Intends to start again by building a foundation towards a successful business


Poor investments and improper relationship management led to a total loss and failure of marriage.
Needs to build a reputable foundation to bring back trust.

Family Serran - His Ex-Wife Child 1 Child 2 Child 3 Child 4
Friends Owl-in-the-Morning - Chief of Family Troop Alfoggotir Ferrondale - Master Artisan who taught him his trade Vimack Badger - Traveling Companion Ronpip Thimble-bimble - Traveling Companion Lorellai - Former Traveling Companion Haggle - Mercantile Contact; can produce bullets from odd materials.
Rivals Billygoat-on-the-Hill - The Chief's Son Daisy - Serran's friend who hates his guts.

Named at birth Ant-Lion-in-the-Summer-Flowers, Antilean travelled with a Tabaxi troop that wanders up and down the continent of Arcadia. The troop itself is lax and free for expression among other troop members, and believe in the powers of discovery and bartering. Antilean served his troop well as a hunter, meeting his long term partner during a botched hunt, where she had saved him from a large beast. In time, the tables were turned, and Antilean saved her. And together, they declared their undying love for one another, and raised kids over the course of a few years.
However. A new interest peeked Antilean's curiosity. Visiting a Rock Gnome settlement, new objects never before seen that work in ways never imagined had caused Antilean to become obsessed. Enough that he would tinker in the wee hours of the night, while his wife slept with the children to comfort them. At one point, when the troop passed by a Dwarven settlement, a master artisan in the ways of smithing intricate items was intrigued with Antilean as much as Antilean was intrigued with him. He would take him in as a strange apprentice, to register under Dwarven Apprenticeship and Certification, and become a master artisan like the Dwarf himself. But he would have to leave his family. Antilean promised Serran that he would come back to her, with crats and riches and comforts like no other. Serran was suppotive if no hurt, but supportive.
Years passed, gruelling training, mounds of paperwork, moulds made and moulds lost, fur singed and fur grown; Antilean became a certified Dwarven Grade Artisan in Small Item Smithing, and his experimental creation, the hand cannon, impressed his Dwarven judges with such fine craftmanship from a novice crafter. Now, it was up to Antilean to go back out into the world, and develop his technique, though under Non-Disclosure of Dwarven learning and crafting techniques, which, by Dwarven Law of Written Stone, will not and cannot be contractually shared outside those of the Pact of Written Stone. Years passed, investments made and failed, contacts saved and lost; and a letter from Sarren arrives in the postal letting Antilean know that it is clear his passions laid elsewhere, and not with those he once loved. She called off the marriage, and they were officially considered separated.
Still determined to prove he can make it big in the economic world of venture capitalism, Antilean went to the Capital City of Vasaaros, the perfect place to trade. Someone there would seek his contraption that fired small bullets with explosions in quick succession. Someone there would kickstart his business... Though, perhaps not in the way he had expected...
Successes Successfully passed the Trials of Water with Lorellai Remade communication with Mercantile Contact Haggle Embraced the Call of the Hero and awakened a lion within. {{Gestalted}} Defended the Capital City of Vasaaros against an invading army.
Critical Wounds

item.title: Arcane Wyvern
item.description:
Infobox Pronounced: "-"

Overview

Family
Friends Vimack Badger - Master Ronpip Thimble-bimble - Traveling Companion Dorizoul - Trusting Antilean - Traveling Companion
Rivals

Critical Wounds Critically Injured by the magical maul wielded by Priestess Yurreina Paramoure; Permanent dispel magic runic inscription burned on to her left eye area.
Hatched from a strange stone egg, the creature's origin is unknown. Though magically oriented creatures seem to indicate that it is heavily of arcane origin, whatever that would mean. Though, this would slightly explain the strange qualities of the creature. The ability to breathe out arcane magic; a fear or inability to see beyond things translucent; its shape not following standard evolutionary anatomy.
Just where did Rozahhar come across that egg?
Has a strong connection with Vimack Badger, who is able to command her to take certain actions. Her personality is very similar to a herding dog. She seems to be able to sense magic, but does not seem able to communicate this directly. She understands common speech, however, to a level similar to an adult human, yet seems unphased emotionally to the unkind words dragons and dragon-like beings.

The Tool of War is a startling piece of sentient equipment. It seems more than just a weapon with a voice, providing power above understanding, have knowledge of things beyond what a magical item would know, and has an unknown history that is hard to know if it is worth discovering. But while it is in Ronpip's possession, understanding can only be beneficial.

item.title: Vimack Badger
item.description:
Infobox Pronounced: "Vihm-ehk Bah-jher"

Overview



Since Vimack was never raised in the ways of the Giants, the discoveries of the Goliath people and what they have left behind interest him.
It is not necessarily that he wishes to find his parents, but he does wish to know more about his people


The strange egg must have come from somewhere, and Vimack wants to know more about his Dragon Companion


Vimack has a strong judgement of what it means for things to be fair. A Fair Trade, a Fair Fight, a Fair Punishment, etc.
Vimack vocalizes this philosophy if he does not feel he can directly act upon it, respecting not all situations need to be his own.

Family Ronpip Thimble-bimble - "Brother" Arcane Wyvern - Wyvern Companion
Friends Evan Escence - Traveling Companion Yohan Sheppard - Founder of Dragon's Head Kashoon - Temporary Travelling Companion Hysseld - Hidden Guardian of Dragon's Head Roxanne - Long Lost Crush from Thimbleville Dorizoul - A Illvidri Herald leader who "awoke" the storm within him.
Rivals The Beak - Owner of Criminal Ring

Raised in Thimbleville, Vimack was abandoned near the settlement at a young age. He was raised by the Thimble-bimble family of gnomes, who treated him no different than they treated their only son, Ronpip. Together, the two would get into all sorts of trouble, despite Ronpip being centuries older than Vimack. Still, Vimack grew up to become an apprentice blacksmith, and Ronpip was called off on a Fighter's Guild mission away from town.
While Ronpip way away, Vimack's talents as a natural warrior shined when he kept the town safe by fending off wild beasts, and helped with its defenses by smithing their tools and weapons with a quality held higher than most other gnome smiths. When he became of age, he trained with Rangers within the area, learning how to work with the land and protect those who need it most. And in a few years time, he received a letter from Ronpip to join him on an adventure to found a new town up North. Vimack would pack his bags, hug his mother and father gnomes with wide arms and deep tears, before setting off to discover new things for himself, and embrace his brother once more.
Despite originating from what should have been the Goliath Wanderers, Vimack had never felt the call to wander himself, nor did he feel compelled to learn who his blood relatives were. However, any instance of Giants and Goliaths alike would peek his curiosity, as he had known he was no gnome, and wanted to know more about his mysterious culture that seemed to be beyond most other's grasps.
Successes Helped solve the first murder in the New Found Town Helped found the new town of Dragon's Head Killed Undead in the city of Massarnae that tried to rise from their graves. Got his name returned when it was stolen by Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler the Pixie. Successfully passed the Trials of Water with Lorellai Defended the Capital City of Vasaaros against an invading army.
Critical Wounds Critically Injured by a Bear; Permanent Five Clawed Scar across side of head Critically Injured by a Helmed Horror; Two permanent blackened scars on the torso of the body. Critically Injured by a monk patrolman; Has an aching rib on his right side from the blow that never really goes away. Critically Injured by a Cultist; A large scar sits deep into his shoulder and collarbone area. Critically Injured by a Elven Archer; A small but deep scar from where the arrow pierced still lingers, causing a stiffness to remain that needs to be carefully stretched often.

item.title: Session 01
item.description:
The adventure begins with the introduction of the main cast, who have been hired by Caravan Leader Yohan Sheppard in the town of Massarnae in the region of Arcaedia.
Vimack Badger, a ranger from the mountains to help guide the caravan from danger and lead the town to resources.
Ronpip Thimble-bimble, a mercenary who once fought in the Gnome Wars. Is currently a member of the Fighter's Guild Blackwood Company.
Evan Escence, a noble's son run away from home seeking the adventure he's always read about.
Along with them, Tyrian Cromwell has gathered a group of militia men to help secure the new town from dangers until proper defenses can be risen.
While the caravan rests in town and prepares to leave in the morning, the party chooses to follow Evan, who sends a courier through The Arcaedian Postal Service to his family to tell them where he is currently and where he intends to be should they send a reply, written in Evan's Letter to his Family. Vimack also wishes to send a letter, to Thimbleville.
The next morning, the party begins its 4 day journey towards the earlier scouted area that Yohan would like to start a town in. Although, during the travel, Evan is suffering from Style. Everyone is gravely concerned.

Part way through the travel, at a night's rest, the party notices they are being watched by a Nothic. Tyrian ordered one of his militia to take care of it, costing a militia man as the creature retaliated.
Failure Tyrian is displeased with the party for costing on of his men their life and has a negative outlook on them at this time.

The party comes upon the clearing they will camp out at; Vimack would like to scout further around to make sure the area is safe. Yohan wants to start choosing the resource to focus on first. The party volunteers to scout the forest for good trees to cut down for wood, while the party suggests sending the militia to start hunting to acquire food and skins.
Success The party has successfully convinced Tyrian to increase security by lowering the number of men to hunt.
While scouting around, the party encounters Black Bears. The party attempts to hide to avoid a fight, but are caught. Combat ensues.
Attention Vimack has been critically injured during the fight and has a scar across his face caused by the critical attack.

After a short rest from the encounter, the party comes across a once sealed cave. They discover a Mysterious Cave. Inside they discover a unique symbol that almost looks like a spider on a time dial, a Time Spider. They also discover the skeletal remains of Drow elves, which seem like they have been trapped here for quite some time. Deeper still, they discover a Mirror Wall Made of Time Crystal.
Seeing their reflections, Ronpip tries to interact with his, triggering the mirror. The party is drowned in a liquid of space-time, and they are melded with a multiverse branch of themselves.
Attention Evan drank from the crystal liquid of time. Consequences: Unknown

The party reawakens, finds that they have strange memories and knowledge. They are greeted by a militia from the caravan, who is as confused as they are but for different reasons. He tells the party they've been missing for three days. The militiaman tries to hurry them back to the caravan, as they have come to an emergency that requires more personal help from the party.
Upon reaching the camp, and find a medical tent has been risen at the center of camp. Inside are soldiers suffering from acid burns, bites, and scratches. They say a large black reptile attacked them while they were hunting. The party gathers information of the whereabouts of the attacker, and then proceed to rest before seeking out the attacker.
Upon waking, Vimack seeks medical attention for his ear. Ronpip needs to get questions of his chest, and Dr. Hammond recommends speaking to a man named Old Man Haggard in town. They find him in a fairly obvious spot at the center of camp. The confront him with mirror magic questions, their absence, and any assistance they may obtain. He provides them a Rod of Elements in order to assist them, but demands it back once they finish.
Before they head out to the forest, Evan checks to see if a courier has come for him but, unfortunately, one has not come. With nothing left, they head out into the forest.

The party stumbles upon and takes on a Black Dragon Wyrmling. Combat ensues.
Secret The Black Dragon Wyrmling was a spawn of an Albino Black Dragon that lives nearby, and used its mother's name in vain to threaten the party.
Success The party successfully slays the Black Dragon Wyrmling, obtaining the venom sac that produces the caustic fluids plaguing the militia men who fought it and using its head to adorn the front gate and inspire others.
Error The Party did not use the Rod of Elements
The party returns to camp, triumphant. But the return is ill received, as the new town's first murder has happened, and the criminal is at large.
And the Criminal Investigations begins in Session 02
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 02
item.description:
Following Session 01,

Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Vimack Badger, and Evan Escence return from their victory against the Black Dragon Wyrmling, only to see the town is gathered in the rain for some grave news.
Yohan Sheppard explains a murder has been committed in the unnamed town. The worker was killed in his tent, along with his wife. The worker’s name was Kent Turringfield, and his wife was Lora Turringfield. Tyrian Cromwell mentions his militia has had to stop Kent quite a few times for his discrimination.
The party investigates the tent and questions the locals. The locals do not provide very useful information. They try the Cook's area; they find out Kent is fairly racist against anyone who is not Arcaedian.

Vimack lingers behind, and notices that some Hvergelmir have stopped nearby. He speaks to Dorizoul, who seems to be a leader to this group. She sees a storm within Vimack's soul, and asks him to come back later.
Meeting together, they share what knowledge they've gathered. Vimack returns to the Hvergelmir that have camped near the town. Dorizoul meets with Vimack and helps him awaken it with a Ritual of Calm, revealing an inner storm from within that he can now channel without and become a Illvidri Herald, branded as a Brother of the Storm.
Vimack and Ronpip return to camp and then to bed. Evan lucid dreams into his mindscape and finds a stranger there. Fidchelle the Aspect of Lore has invaded into his mindscape. The being points out Evan's lineage, and then presents him the Ring of Shooting Stars, whose purpose is also not yet known. Evan assumes its some sort of trinket gift.

Evan awakens, he checks on his party and begins to talk to his imagine friend. A soldier spots My Immortal and screams, waking Ronpip and Vimack. The party calms down and agrees to get breakfast. However, Ronpip's greatsword is missing. Vimack notices the Hvergelmir have left camp before the morning while they are walking to the Cook's area. The party wishes to hang out with the Hill Dwarves while eating breakfast in hopes to obtain some info. There they are greeted by Thurdrum of Aspintimber, woodwork chief of the hill dwarves in town. They mention they do not smith, but there is a half-orc in town who does it instead. And to remind him to return the hammer he borrowed. Ronpip inquires about the engineering nature of the watermill, but Thurdrum tells him to seek out the gnome engineers in town, Xotor and Paudri.
Ronpip decides to go see about the half-orc blacksmith, Asatir. He asks about his greatsword and Kent. He says he's gotten in a few fights with Kent and has not seen his greatsword.
Vimack and Evan go to see the elven related folk who joined the town. They explain that they are hunters and gatherers for the town for now. They ask if they've had problems with Kent, though they've only been verbally abused and nothing more.
They seek out Ferdinand, Kent's foreman. He describes Kent as hotheaded and gets into fights but he was a hard worker none-the-less. He mentions that his axe broke and had to go to the half-orc blacksmith. He got into a tussle with Asatir but came back alive and bruised.
The party all goes to see Asatir and continue to question him about Kent. Since he's the only blacksmith in town, he mentions that most projects go to him, and Kent does not like anything orc related. He mentions that his hammer was stolen, which is why he had to borrow one from the Dwarves, though its not fit for his work. It was stolen a couple nights ago, and he chucked one of his unfinished knives at the thief and missed, but all he saw was a mottled skinny fellow but no details.
Ronpip attempts to use Vimack as a distraction while Evan investigates that knife. Ronpip sneaks up to the door, and opens it. He spots an orc woman inside. He tries to retreat but the orc woman has spotted him. She charges him. Asatir calms her and regathers the party. Asatir explains that she is Miroz, his wife. The party begins to think that someone was setting Asatir up to appear to be the murderer.
The party investigates the Gnomes in town. They unfortunately know nothing about a missing greatsword or hammer.

While resounding on their information, the party realizes they need to return the Rod of Elements to Old Man Haggard. They discover his wagon has disappeared, but not been moved. It either teleported or floated away. Evan attempts to see if something invisible remains, but there's nothing there. Even the locals say the space was empty. They return to Tyrian Cromwell and Yohan Sheppard to try and ask about the militia and Old Man Haggard. Ronpip investigates Tyrian Cromwell's bunk but nothing seems out of the ordinary.
While re-investigating the tend of Kent and Lora, My Immortal manifests by itself, startling the party. Out of reaction, Ronpip summons his greatsword, The Sundering Blackiron to his hands.

They settle down and, at the advisal of My Immortal, they go seeking the half elves again. They discover a tent has a shallow hole into it, with a bloodied dagger and hammer inside. During this moment of revelation, the suspects return to their tent. Upon their entrance, Ronpip summons the The Sundering Blackiron, Evan summons My Immortal, and Vimack steps out from his hiding spot. A wild tussle in attempt to capture the suspects ensues.
The party manages to capture the two, and they reveal their names are Falkoris and Sylkilia, brothers and in service to The Shadow Snappers and The Beak to keep an eye on the town. As a threat, Ronpip weighs their lives to get more information. He executes one on the spot, causing the other to be in fear and confess as much as he knows. Vimack, feeling remorseful of his brother's actions, suggest exiling the remaining brother, but chooses to shoot him in the back and leave him to nature as a form of mercy. The party overall feels very grimly over the events, and decide they need time to process things while helping the town develop into something settle worthy, until Session 03
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 03
item.description:
Following Session 02:
The party has taken a few weeks to gather their composure and help the town. Vimack Badger has been helping with building and major physical labor, taking advantage of his strength, as well as helping Asatir with Blacksmithing. He's been avoiding Yohan Sheppard and Tyrian Cromwell due to some conflicting inner thoughts.
Evan Escence took to the forest to meditate and recover his knowledge of his powers. He heals Vimack's hearing loss. And proceeds to use his powers to help heal town members.
Ronpip Thimble-bimble has the militia with their patrols and training. Tyrian is pleased by this development. While not helping the militia, he contributes to the engineering tasks. He has been avoiding Yohan Sheppard.
The town has since developed quite quickly, with several residential homes already up and living in. Yohan has had himself a Mayor's House built for him and his family. Tyrian now lives in a Captain's Lodge so that he no longer has to stay with his militia men. And the Cook has started a proper tavern he has dubbed The Stewmasters Flaggon.
Yohan will finally ask the three party members to see him at his home. He will be greeted and present them with a conundrum, which is naming the town. Evan suggests the name Dragon's Head and everyone agrees it is a good name. Yohan needs the party to return to Massarnae and officiate the town through Arcaedian law. Tyrian offers some horses to help the party. Asatir requests to join, for business of his own.
A couple of days of travel to Massarnae and the party arrives at the gates by morning. The guards give them some guidance. The Party is told to go to Hooke's Law District to officiate the town through legal means. Asatir seeks to go to the The Masse Market to handle his business.
The party passes through The Kepler Commons, and notice a foul odor in the air. The party acknowledges the weirdness but continues on their original mission to officiate the town. After officiating Dragon's Head as a official, legal town under Massarnae oversight, the party tries to go back to The Arcaedian Postal Service but stop at the The Kepler Commons being bothered by the smell. Ronpip wants to investigate, since it smells like dead person.
Ronpip takes the party to the market district, and seeks a perfume sales man. Upon finding one, Evan chimes in and asks for perfumes from Noble House of Escence but the man has sold out on most of them. Vimack is surprised that the man is legit about his family and history and not just a meme.
The party returns to the manhole that leads into the Sewers where the party discover two dead corpses. As the party investigates, they are attacked by Ochre Jellys.
Victory! The party slays the Ochre Jellys
The party searches the corpses for anything useful. They find various trinkets left behind. Ronpip collects some Ooze Goo from a glass jar the party was able to pilfer from the dead bodies.
The party exits the sewers. The party asks if there is any place they can clean up after being praised by the locals. They are told of a few places. The Pinewood Cup, The Druids Grove, a place in the noble's district, a place at the slum, The Boar's Pint, and lastly the Leatherback Tunn.
The Evan decides to seek the The Arcaedian Postal Service to check on a response to his letter. He receives his reply and they decided to meet back up with Asatir in the The Masse Market.
Ronpip heads over to the Tachyon Divinity to try and feel better about his actions in the previous weeks. However, mid confession, bells start to ring and a local screams about undead in the area.
The party manages to find itself back together, with Evan and Vimack hearing all the commotion and spotting Ronpip. They spot the undead, and begin to fight them off!
Victory! The party defeats some Zombies!
Secret The Zombies were a result of an experiment through the High Elven locals in preparation for taking over the town come Winter
Local temple keepers provide a couple of rewards to the party for helping. Some gold, health potions, and a Glass Bottle of the Acolyte. The party heads to the The Masse Market to either find Asatir or take a moment to rest and recuperate at the Leatherback Tunn. The party notices a particular exotic shop keeper at the center of the market area, Rozahhar. Vimack decides to purchase a Strange Stone Egg from him. A spark comes from Vimack and awakens something within the egg.
Caution Rozahhar feels swindled by this development and has taken ill will to the party. Should be come upon the party again, he will not be so welcoming to their presence again.
The party sells the gem's they've acquired and some magic scrolls they are not able to identify themselves. Vimack asks a random wizard nearby named Joe to identify them for cheap. The wizard reads them and reveals they are a Scroll of Thorn Whip and two Scroll of Chill Touch. The wizard also notices Evan's ring he received from Fidchelle the Aspect of Lore. He identifies it as the Ring of Shooting Stars. They say goodbye to Joe and pray they may meet him again.
The party manages to find Asatir again, though he has mixed feelings about having missed everything that the party went through. The Strange Stone Egg begins to crack slightly in Vimack's hand, setting Ronpip into a concern.
A bard Tiefling approaches the party to see if they were the ones that cleared the sewer and dealt with the undead. Pleasantly surprised, he asks if he could join the party on an adventure to help him write a book. He introduces himself as Kashoon. The party wants to rest for the night and refresh from their fights and soiling. Kashoon recommends the Leatherback Tunn, though he lacks any coin.
Within the Leatherback Tunn, the party are greeted by a host who introduces himself as The Pen. The party purchases five separate rooms for 40 silver, paid by Ronpip Thimble-bimble. Ronpip gives Kashoon 5 gold pieces and tells him to get a drink. Vimack takes Kashoon to the bar front and speak to The Rain for drinks. Vimack then gives him an additional 29 gold pieces, leaving Kashoon with 39 gold pieces on his person. Evan and Vimack head upstairs to bathe and rest. Evan notices that all of his shampoos are of House Escence products, but takes no further thought into it. And the party falls asleep into their bathes...
Only to find themselves moved from their rooms into a basement area greeting room, still naked and still in their bathes. A Kenku is at a desk taking notes and repeats what the party is saying instinctually. Vimack tries to approach the Kenku, but a Tiefling steps out to stop him. Behind the Tiefling, The Beak steps out from the shadows to stand by the Kenku. The Beak demands the party not interfering in The Shadow Snappers activities, revealing they are some sort of criminal ring with ties to Dragon's Head. The party tries to justify they will not interfere if The Beak does better, though The Beak simply finds it amusing. The party is allowed to leave, and they come back to Kashoon, and find Asatir is very drunk.
The party decides to remain in Massarnae to do some additional research on the tower deed and a few other things. They head to the library per recommendation of the town guard. Vimack tries to find more information on the Strange Stone Egg that Vimack has, but information seems fairly scarce. Evan is interested in the Illvidri Heralds, but ends up showing him entries on Storm Gods to catch Vimack's interest. Vimack is more interested in the egg however. Ronpip seeks a librarian, and they try to present the egg to the librarian for more info. However, the egg begins to open.
Out comes out a baby wyvern of strange anatomy. Evan loses his shit and Vimack activates his motherly instincts. Ronpip is concerned. Ronpip and Evan cannot find info in the library for what it eats, so Ronpip presents it rations; this aggravates the wyvern hatchling and it fires an Arcane Missile from its mouth at Ronpip. Ronpip is unphased.
The party decides to head back to Dragon's Head with Kashoon in tow. Evan asks if the wyvern has a name, but Vimack has not named it though he has an idea. Nearly there to Dragon's Head, the party hears a Dragon's Roar emanating from the forest. Two strangers run towards and away from the party. A Hysseld crashes through the forest chasing after them, and tells the two in common to not return. The party greets it, and startled, it runs back into the forest. Vimack chases after it, but the dragon polymorphs into a deer to outrun him. The party loses the deer at a log that crosses the river as a natural bridge, with the deer's tracks implying that it has jumped into the river.
The party realizes there is a waterfall at the cliff near the town. The party decides they want to give the deed and then investigate the cliff. The party gives Yohan Sheppard the town deed. Yohan Sheppard rewards the party with 100 gold each for their troubles.
The party decides since the day is still new, to investigate the cliff waterfall across the river. They shimmy through a narrow ridge behind the waterfall, where a cavern has been secreted within where something has been residing. Exploring the complex in Session 04
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 04
item.description:
Following Session 03 :
Vimack Badger, Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Evan Escence, and Kashoon enter the cavern hidden within the waterfall on the cliffside near the town of Dragon's Head. At the end of the cavern, there is a room with a particular function to create tension, but is otherwise harmless, as well as an open well with bismuth liquid swirling within.
Evan dips his mace into the well. The mace now has a flaming property. He also dips his bolts in, and they receive an explosive property.
Ronpip tries to dip his sentient sword in but the sword advises against it. Ronpip instead dips his short sword in, giving it the lightning property. Ronpip dips a set of arrows in and they also receive an explosive property.
Vimack dips his short swords in, and they have poison and ice properties, respectively. He also dips 19 arrows into the vat, giving them the petrifying property.
The party enter the next room. There is a giant sign that says "Greeting Room" in large letters. There is a large statue at the centre of the room made of brass depicting a hero by the name of Havvrod, the Knight of Gold. A wind up box that Vimack begins to wind explains that this is some sort of Exhibition Room dedicated to this hero, and a new door opens. As the party explores, everything looks forlorn and left to waste. They come upon a security room with magic mirrors depicting other rooms within the facility. The party comes upon a Lost and Found area, and discover a set of paired bracelets Lost & Found and a Ion Stone of Intellect.
The party makes their way to a hall of statues, where the armours come to life! Combat Ensues against the Animated Armors.
After combating the armours, the party pushes forward, and enter an abandoned amphitheatre, a strangely clean relic room, and gallery of ancient paintings and statues. Evan renews his Detect Magic and realises that Ronpip has a magic object in his pocket. He notices its fairly powerful in its enchantment. Ronpip fumbles with it, and discovers it is an Ion Stone of Intellect. The party goes back the amphitheatre and Vimack notices a false wall, and discover a spiral stairwell going downwards that get bigger as they go down. Vimack wishes to run down the stairs in excitement and Ronpip wishes to get out of the mist by climbing up Vimack. Evan and Ronpip end up walking normally down the stairs instead.
Vimack comes upon the dragon's chamber, enormous rooms dedicated to things larger than himself. The rest of the party catches up and find Vimack gawking at the environment. Vimack decides to sneak through the area, along with his other companions. They proceed towards the observatory that appears to be under the river near Dragon's Head. At its center, a rectangular table with hologram of the town and its residents.
Caught observing the holograms, the party suddenly finds itself blown by a powerful wind and shunted into a new space unlike the dwellings of the dragon. Except for Evan, who remained, unaffected by the wind and unafraid of a golden dragon baring down on him.
Evan Escence converses with the gold dragon, revealing he and his companions went through the Exhibition Rooms, to which the Golden Dragon immediately apologises for the party having to venture through it. He brings the party back, introduces himself with many names, his true name as Hysseld but tells the party they've called him Dr. Hammond before, and asks for the rod. Vimack tries to share his wyvern to Hysseld, but Hysseld seems most disturbed by the presence of the creature. The party asks Hysseld to help protect the town in their stead, for a favor. He asks the party to retrieve his hammer from an ancient and long forgotten High Elven town where he was magically banished from. He hands a magical lute to Kashoon, which will help return the party to him. He also provides the party one magical item from his storage.
Vimack chooses the Animated Shield Ronpip chooses a Ring of Protection Evan chooses a The Talisman of Pure Good
Hysseld also provides a special book to Evan Escence, one that contains an extensive amount of knowledge accumulated by scribes of Fidchelle the Aspect of Lore. Inside, Evan finds a loose piece of paper inserted into the book with a single name written on it, "Vydimal Thorrestor". Upon writing the name into the Tome of Endless Lore, he discovers The Final Written Words of Vydimal. Hysseld states he was an old friend long lost.
Evan wants more information on the town they plan to go to, and writes out Mira Esmirelda into the Tome of Endless Lore, which provides a pop-up version of the city directly from the pages of the book. Hysseld points out that his hammer would most likely be in the citadel, towards the north most end of the city.
With as much information as the party desires, Hysseld pops the party as close to the city as his magic could take them, which is a Elven gateway into the area claimed for the city. The party passes through the gates, and can feel the residual protection spell still locked in place. However, with the sun already getting low, the party decides to camp out just outside the city's gates before sun down so they can explore the forlorn town in the daylight.
Evan asks Vimack to reveal the symbol on his chest to potentially show information on it. Vimack wants to know more about the Arcane Wyvern, however, the drawing does not reveal information but asks for an entry. Evan tries to write about the Tool of War but the book also produces a page asking for an entry. The party asks about The Beak and the Leatherback Tunn and although it does not return any information on The Beak specifically, it provides a generic description of tavern. The party then asks about The Shadow Snappers, but it also comes out with some generic information, but reveals that the criminal gang has a ring spanning across Arcaedia.
Evan asks Kashoon his opinion of the party, which Kashoon answers awkwardly but honestly. Evan casts Zone of Truth and interrogates Kashoon about The Beak but he denies any knowledge about any criminals, and says he just wanted the freedom of Barddom to escape his former occupation.
Evan finally reads his House Escence's Reply that he had on him for a few days, revealing that the Noble Houses have been vying for power, and his return is requested to be expedited as being the first born son puts him in line for the throne and threatens the reputation of House Escence.
While taking watch, Ronpip Thimble-bimble takes first watch, and his anxiety keeps him on edge but nothing significant happens. Evan Escence takes second watch, and spots glowing humanoid silhouettes glowering at him and the party. Vimack Badger takes final watch, and those glowering figures are back, with more than what Evan described. He stares them down through the night...
The party picks up their camp, and enters the Emerald Mire into Session 05
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 05
item.description:
Following Session 04 :
Ronpip Thimble-bimble , Evan Escence , Vimack Badger , and Kashoon pack up their camp from just outside Mira Esmirelda and enter the town. They start by heading towards the plaza passed the rotted buildings that are slowly being consumed by the swamp. Seeing nothing left about to find, they head to the temple area. At the center, they find a statue of Angharradh made of moonstone, untouched by the swamps corruptions. Ronpip regards how much the statue might be worth, and its apparent that it would be worth a lot of coin. This makes him wonder why the people would just leave such an expensive statue.
With nothing else catching their interest, they move to the citadel. Vimack Badger tears open the gates to allow the party to enter into the area. The party enters the citadel, and it is dark, dank, and stale air. Exploring through, they first encounter a Wraith and Specters of long dead elven soldiers who demand them to leave.
Fail Ronpip shoots Vimack in the ass with a Volcanic Arrow, setting it on fire
Success The party successfully defeats the incorporeal enemies.
After the encounter, Vimack continues to explore, and stumbles into a room with a Banshee crying inside. Vimack panics and tries to shut the door, but Ronpip opens it, taking a swipe. She wails and shakes the walls, knocking Kashoon and Ronpip out. Evan and Vimack manage to bring Kashoon and Ronpip back to consciousness, and the party defeats the Banshee.
Success The party successfully defeats the Banshee
The party takes a Short Rest, and then continue to search for the Hammer. They come upon a tapping noise, and investigate, only to be spotted by and attacked by a Revenant, that specifically targets Evan.
Fail The Revenant critically strikes Evan, and damages him to the point of near death.
Success Vimack successfully slays the Revenant
Evan discovers a black ring in the ashes of the Revenant and pockets it.
The party then decides they need to take a long rest before continuing to explore, braving the potential dangers by setting up camp within the citadel. The dangers testing their resolve in Session 06
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 06
item.description:
Following Session 05 :
Vimack Badger , Ronpip Thimble-bimble , Kashoon , and Evan Escence pickup their camp after resting for an extended amount of time to heal and recover, and unbarricade the doors to continue exploring the citadel for the hammer in Mira Esmirelda.
While exploring, the party comes across a tapestry depicting the goddess Angharradh blessing the Great General Vadathaus Horreneth, a blessed leader who conquered swathes of human territory in the long ended war between ancient Arcaedians and the High Elves.
Note Kashoon have given Evan Escence his dagger to help him strike with melee attacks.
The party continues to explore, and trigger a trap.
Fail Vimack takes significant damage from a falling stone block.
At the end of the hallway where the trap was triggered, a chest lays in wait. The chest is trapped and releases a puff of gas. Inside is 800 copper, 4000 silver, 1800 gold, and 138 platinum coins, a leather coin purse, a copper clothed tabard, an ornate silver mirror, an ornate ivory drinking horn, lapis urn, platinum amulet, and 3 spell scrolls, and two potions. One is red, and one is brownish.
They explore further and discover a rather well preserved anvil, however, the party are unable to find a way to take it with them. Vimack crashes through the next door, where the west side of the room contains a kiln and coal hold. In the opposite corner of the room, a large round mass cries.
The party tries to sneak around the Beholder Zombie but Kashoon trips and creates noise.
Fail Vimack critically misses the beholder and the fear effect of the Beholder Zombie nearly gets to him.
Success Kashoon kills the Beholder Zombie
Evan scribes the Beholder Zombie into the Tome of Endless Lore and comes to find that the beholder is a little out of place for the area. Evan investigates a pile of rubble and discovers another black ring.
Evan then thinks he should burn the Beholder Zombie corpse they had recently killed.
Fail Evan poisons himself from the smoke caused by burning the zombie flesh of the Beholder Zombie
Ronpip pushes forward but steps on a magical sigil that causes him to be paralyzed. The party pulls him out easily but he remains paralyzed. Vimack slaps him in the face to slap him to try and break him out of the paralysis, though it does nothing. Ronpip feels everything. The party creates a plan to try and cross the magic sigil, and then Ronpip is freed from his plight, face hurting. He pulls out rope, and jumps the gap.
Fail Ronpip tries to jump the gap, but everything that could have gone wrong, went wrong. However, Ronpip is able to overcome the paralysis.
One by one, they jump the corner and avoid the trap's antics any further.
Further up the hall, the party pushes further, and come across a Ghast and three Ghouls gnawing at bones and rotted flesh. Ronpip initiates with Create Bonfire to surprise them.
Success The party eliminates the Ghast and Ghouls
The party goes up stairs and come across two large iron doors at the top. Vimack suggests resting before entering the iron doors. The party tries to rest, and the citadel taunts them in their rest, testing their resolve. But each of them manages to ignore the disquiet around them. They rest until 3am, pack up, and enter the room beyond the iron doors.
Inside is a long destroyed by time War Room, where Vadathaus Horreneth sits at the end of the table, and his generals still sit at the sides. Behind Vadathaus Horreneth lies a silver and gold warhammer, the one they sought at the behest of Hysseld. As the party enters the room Vadathaus Horreneth begins to stir, Ronpip casts Shatter. Vadathaus Horreneth retaliates with a Fear attack.
Evan tries to have a civil discussion with Vadathaus Horreneth, who is already displeased by his specific presence. However, Evan mentions they were sent by Hysseld to retrieve the hammer, which triggers his anger, displeased that the party is in league with a dragon, and that the elves will rule again when they obtain the Facets of Virtue.
The fight beginning in Session 07
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 07
item.description:
Following Session 06 :
Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Evan Escence, and Vimack Badger (accompanied by Kashoon) find themselves in combat with an undead general who has brought back to life the armours of his long dead generals.
Vadathaus Horreneth leashes Vimack with lightning and blows an ominous gust of wind that closes the door behind the party, trapping them with their undead assailants.
Caution One of the Helmed Horrors critically wounds Vimack with a Necrotic Longsword.
Meanwhile, Helmed Horrors block the rest of the party from assisting Vimack. Luckily, his Animated Shield protects his back.
Caution Ronpip Thimble-bimble is critically damaged by one of the Helmed Horrors
Fail Evan Escence critically fails his Guiding Bolt, causing it to fizzle out.
After three rounds of combat, the party is beginning to feel the weight of the battle against them.
Success The Helmed Horrors have critically missed some of their attacks.
Evan creates a psionic wall between him and the Horrors and plans to make maneuvers.
Vimack drops a short sword and in a rage, rips the Hammer out of its stone hold, enveloping him with light and freeing him from Vadathaus' spell.
He tries to convince Kashoon to use the Lute of Returning, but it does nothing as they are still in within the barrier that prevents Hysseld from entering the area.
Caution Vimack is critically injured by a Helmed Horror again!
Ronpip manages to chuck his sword directly into Vadathaus, and teleports for the first time back to his sword, and manages to his him with two attacks.
While wielding the Hammer of Hero's Gold, Vimack notices the Helmed Horrors have lost their vigor.
Success Vadathaus Horreneth critically missed Ronpip and he takes advantage of it with an Attack of Opportunity
Vadathaus Horreneth fends off the party with his might, downing Evan and Ronpip. Kashoon heals Evan and stabilizes him from death.
Success Vimack takes advantage of a Critical Miss, striking down a Helmed Horror with an upwards swing, and cleave through the armor with a blunt weapon. Motes of light spawn upon the Hammer of Hero's Gold and he directs them to Evan, bringing him back to consciousness.
Conscious, Evan is being carried away by Helmed Horrors. He summons the might of My Immortal and bolsters his strength and flies straight into the air, taking the Helmed Horrors with him and crashing them into the ceiling and back to the ground.
Succeed Kashoon gives Ronpip a potion. Ronpip reawakens and attacks Vadathaus Horreneth, Critically Hitting him AND killing him.
Vadathaus Horreneth dies once again and forever more. The Helmed Horrors that remain fall to the floor, still once more. Dawn peeks through the ceiling, and the cold morning air makes the victory feel sweetest.
The Arcane Wyvern, Dorizoul suddenly evolves and grows to a medium size, surprising everyone.
They look through Vadathaus Horreneth's items. They find a Bag of Bounty, Adamantine Armor, Moon Blessed Double Scimitar, Cloak of Elvenkind, and Dagger of Warning.
They try to have Kashoon play the Lute of Returning again, but it seems the spell stopping Hysseld is still active.
The party makes their way outside the gates of Mira Esmirelda and Kashoon plays the Lute of Returning. Just before he finishes the song, a Judge of Arcaedia tries to stop the party. But with the song ending, the party is teleported into Hysseld's chamber.
The party returns the Hammer of Hero's Gold and make sure the town is safe according to Hysseld's table of the town. The party recounts their time in Mira Esmirelda, and Hysseld lore drops about the Elves and the Anti-Human war. He also warns to the party that if the High Elves are invading, they would move when the first snow falls, and suggests going to the Capital to warn the leaders of the impending invasions.
The party returns to Dragon's Head, finding the town has not changed much in the passed three days, putting their hearts and minds at rest.
Vimack Badger takes the party to Yohan Sheppard to let him know that the party has more travels to go to, but that he would like to live here. Ronpip Thimble-bimble and Evan Escence feel the same way, more or less. Yohan tells the party that he needs an upfront pay but to think about how much they are willing to offer.
Kashoon timidly wishes to leave the party, but Vimick beats him to it and offers him a Tulled Leather Coinpurse with a sum of money for his troubles in joining. Evan also gives back his dagger.
The party returns to Yohan Sheppard and provides him with 100 platinum's worth of upfront pay to start the hold for the party.
The party next go to Asatir and try to recover a new short sword for Vimick and possibly work the Adamantine Armor the party acquired, but Asatir says its beyond him unfortunately, and the amount of work to make a short sword would take longer than the party might like.
After a quick dinner, Evan takes to the air by growing wings. While aloft, he notices an armor clad person on horseback sprinting towards the town from the North, the direction that they were before teleporting in.
Evan glides back down and gathers the party to confront the Judge. The Judge questions them about their purpose North of Town, and Ronpip manages to make a convincing excuse for the party's presence in that area. The Judge warns them not to go back there, and then leaves.
They race to the dwarven area, and discuss house plots and the Adamantine Armor. Ronpip Thimble-bimble dons the armor, and is rather surprised at how well it fits when properly fitted. Vimack Badger inquires about the origin of such a metal, and Thurdrum of Aspintimber mentions to seek out the Dwarves in the Southern Mountains.
When the party takes its slumber, Ronpip has a vivid dream in a space within a Parthenon of Metal and Weaponry. He speaks to his weapon given humanoid form, who warns that War is coming. Ronpip asks "War with who?" but receives no response before he suddenly awakens.
The party heads to Hysseld and he discusses where to take the party in order to make preparations in a defence against High Elven invasion. The party agrees to seek the Summerset Princess in Southern Arcaedia, hidden away in a thick and wild forest area. Vimich also asks Hysseld if he has a short sword he could use. Hysseld offers him the Katzbalger of the Promising Hero.
While prepping for the adventure, the party acquires additional items such as arrows, potions, and Evan attempts to identify the two black rings he has in his possession. The first one he tries on the Cursed Ring of Seething which sticks to his finger and refuses to come off. He then tries on the Black Seal, which is also Cursed. Ronpip puts on a magic item that is a Black Skull with a Shield. The party also looks to their Spell Scrolls, but know not what they can do.
After two days have passed, the party returns to Hysseld and he takes them on a speedy flight across the country.
Where the party goes, only Session 08 knows!
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 08
item.description:
Following Session 07 :
Hysseld drops off Evan Escence, Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Vimack Badger, and Dorizoul just north of the forest where he encourages the party to speak with the Summerset Princess. He drops them off at a set of hidden gates, made of branches and plant life. Hysseld warns the party to remain on the path, no matter what they hear or see. Vimack Badger takes the lead, and takes the party deep into the forest as far as he could tell. The stone slab path weaves between the trees. Evan Escence detects they Fey are nearby through his Cursed Ring of Seething, and takes caution. Vimack begins to hear the sound of something struggling off the edge of the path. Being a being of goodness within his large heart, Vimack feels compelled to help what ever creature this is. A couple feet off the path, Vimack comes across a Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler stuck. Meanwhile, Evan and Ronpip hold on a rope tied to Vimack to make sure he can return the path with no issues, or pull him if he is danger. Vimack carefully frees the Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler. The Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler thanks him and introduces himself as Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler, to which he then asks Vimack "May I have your name?". Vimack shakes the Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler's hand, and gives the Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler his name, which causes a puff of pink smoke to blast between them, as now their names are forever(?) exchanged.
Evan Escence and Ronpip Thimble-bimble proceed to question Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler about what just happened. This only angers Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler. In an attempt to chase after the Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler that stole his name, Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler gets his in the back of his head from a log trap and is dropped into a bright blue portal. Ronpip and Evan do their best to contain the rope, but the force of the rope drops Evan to his side as he is dragged into the forest. He tries to grow claws through My Immortal, but the earth is soft the roots don't hold. Ronpip tries to anchor himself down with his weapon, but his grip on the rope and his weapon do not save him. The three of them are left freefalling through the portal, and are thrown out on the otherside, dropping into The Feywild, a plane of dreams, whimsy, and the fey. Before the party could consider recovering, the portal closes behind them and forms a gnarled wooden hole within a tree.
The party goes through several strange events that test their patience, wits, and willingness to deal with whimsical obstructions. This includes a path that loops no matter the direction taken, a satyr who really wants to share his drink, a lake that plays an enticing tune to draw strangers into it, a litter of blink dog pups and their mom, sticky mud trap set up by some tricksters, a brook with a tree man named Kenobade sitting on a boulder while sheparding other tree kin who provides them directions to someone who can help them leave the Feywild, a big rock with a tiny village next to it, little bramble people riding bramble lizards, and a massive lake containing many crabs spawned from a building sized crab.
Finally passed all these obstacles, the party follows a river upstream and comes upon a mushroom house with a watermill. A gnome greets them. He's confused as to why people of the Material Plane are doing in the Feywild. Ronpip explains they were tricked by a Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler into falling into a portal, and TIddlefiddle McBottomfondler says his name was taken. Understanding, the gnome friend prepares a portal back into the Material Plane.
The party finds themselves back in the Summer Forest, but near the city of wood gnomes called Cumberbatch. The gnome friend guides the party through the city, and has to hand Vimack and Evan a special silk mask for them to breath freely from the magical enchantment that would normally put strangers to sleep. He introduces himself as Bonley Shroomcap. He leads them to the Elder's Tree where Elder Torgey Snailback agrees to help the party, specifically Tiddlefiddle McBottomfondler. The Elder prepares a ritual, and returns Vimack Badger's name to him. Relieved, they ask to be guided to the Wood Elven capital to speak with the Summerset Princess. Elder Torgey Snailback volunteers Bonley Shroomcap to take them there for skipping out on his duty days.
He leads the party to Wood Elven city of Bryturdel. The townsfolk do not pay them much mind, and are oddly helpful to them. They direct them to the palace at the edge of town where they can speak to the Summerset Princess about their mission. The party is continued to be surprised at how unguarded the entrance, the town is, and the palace gates. Even the guards are oddly nice to them. When asked if they can see the Summerset Princess, one of the guards has to go check something. He momentarily comes back with General Orthorion who questions them. Vimack reveals that they have come about the High Elves potentially invading. He is skeptical, but allows them passage into the palace. As they walk, the party talks and reveals more details to General Orthorion. He takes them into a Conservatory that acts as the throne room, where the Summerset Princess sits within. She leaves her space and approaches the party with an aura of authority and power. She asks what the party desires with her presence. They are as honest with her as they were with General Orthorion. The Summerset Princess waves the guards of the room off, and her personality switches, revealing her true fey nature. She asks if the party has any proof, but the party has none. Orthorion insists that he and the party can check on The Tree-ty on an island just outside the summer forest. The Summerset Princess accepts, and allows the party to rest and to meet with Orthorion in the morning.
The party meets with Orthorion and a small squadron of elven guard. They take to the water with specially made canoes that wade through the river and into the ocean, and on to The Tree-ty Island. Orthorion and his guards lead the party upon an old path, where at the center of this small island and an intertwined tree of two different species. At first, it appears as though both are standing, but upon closer inspection, one of the two trees has begun to fade and die within. Orthorion, in disbelief, tests it with touch and is tense.
Without warning, the party and the guards are ambushed. The two elven guard brought along were immediately shot through the necks, and the party draws their weapons and prepares themselves for combat in Session 09!
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 09
item.description:
Following Session 08
Ronpip Thimble-bimble , Evan Escence , and Vimack Badger , along side General Orthorion, find themselves ambushed on The Tree-ty Island by unknown assailants, who have dropped two of their escorts. Evan sprouts wings, creates a wall of force to try and separate leaders from lackeys; and moves forward to get an advantage, which draws fire to him.
Critical Damage! Evan is Critically Wounded by one of the Assassins with an arrow and drops the psionic wall
A Druid summons a large bol of moths that bite into Evan while he is in the air, obscuring Evan's vision and Evan from the party. Vimack and Ronpip try to concentrate on one assassin, but he's dodging everything they are throwing at him.
Evan flies straight up to escape the cloud of moths, and uses his Ring of Shooting Stars to fire a ball of lightning at a priestess and a cloaked figure, but they side step the spell. Two assassins attack Vimack, one drawing two arrows that his Animated Shield blocks, but the one in Melee manages to draw his long sword and gets two swipes in. Another shoots at Dorizoul. Another fires two at Evan Escence but misses. The Priests fires a sickly beam of green energy at Evan Escence.
There appears to be an additional enemy that is not making any move or taking any action. He seems to only be observing the party.
Ronpip uses his Tool of War to aim his fireball at a central location, singing several attackers. General Orthorion manipulates his arrows to curve around cover.
Critical Strike! Vimack recklessly attacks and manages to finally score a hit on the assassin who has been dodging him, and it is a critical hit!
With inspiration of the critical hit, he also manages to get his second sword into the assassin. He whistles for Dorizoul to move into position, and she comes in running for a Trample, and knocks him prone. Since Vimack is raging, lightning arcs from his body into the target but he manages to just narrowly dodge a direct hit.
Evan Escence channels psionic energy to direct Ronpip to a location psychically, and then he flies into cover to cure his wounds from the heavy attacks he sustained.
The assassins draw their arrows, two hitting Ronpip and two hitting Vimack and one hitting Dorizoul. The Druid tosses an ice knife at her prone ally, which does not hit but still explodes into ice shards.
Ronpip turns his Tool of War into a sword and goes into melee, missing his first strike but hitting his second. Othorion continues to pelt his intended target. Vimack strikes with two attacks and kills the assassin by taking his short swords straight through his chest. Dorizoul charges to her shooter and Tramples him over. Vimack whistles and she kicks him while he is prone, but his armor protects him from her stomps. Vimack moves over in preparation, and lightning arcs from his body to the now prone attacker. Evan channels his psionic powers and creates an area of darkness, covering the area of the druid, the priestess, and the being who has only been watching the entire combat. He then calls upon My Immortal to attack the assassin with Ronpip, but she misses as he parries her.
The assassin with Ronpip manages to catch one hit in with his frosted longsword against Ronpip. One tries to make hail mary shots towards Evans but miss terribly. The prone assassin attacks from prone, with one strike hitting Vimack at the legs with his own frosted longsword. The priestess in darkness attempts to dispel the darkness but finds she could not.
Ronpip channels a Second Wind and attacks his target while casting Booming Blade across his sword. Sonic energy surrounds the assassin.
Critical Strike! Ronpip makes a second strike critically striking, and goes from the right side of his neck and through his armor to his arm, bisecting him.
Othorion continues to curve his arrows around cover. Vimack continues his rage and strikes out against the prone assassin, but only one short sword hits. Dorizoul follows up with kicks, which Vimack follows up with another short sword attack, and then bears down his lightning strike. Evan commands My Immortal to strike and she fills the assassin with holes with blinding speed of her rapier. Evan then compels Vimack to attack twice again, in which one of the strikes find purchase.
The assassin that was prone will flip back to his feet. Vimack manages to get a hit on him, but the assassin retaliates with a strike of his own, dropping Vimack. The druid transforms within the sphere darkness.
Ronpip tosses his sword in Othorion's direction, and then teleports to it, telling him "We need to get outta here!" but Othorion does not seem to take heed. He instead fires two arrows into the darkness and knows he hit, before moving to cover. Dorizoul does her best defend Vimack, and she blasts him with her arcane breathe attack. Evan calls upon Healing Word to revive Vimack.
Meanwhile, nothing has happened within the sphere of darkness. No one has entered or left.
Ronpip rallies Vimack and gives him an extra moment of vigor. Othorion continues to fire upon something in the sphere of darkness with his bow and arrows, using magical enchantments that the party does not understand. The party can hear the sounds of a canine getting wounded but see nothing. Vimack stands and consumes a potion to help heal his wounds from battle. Everyone repositions themselves until Evan can drop the sphere of darkness. Evan compels Othorion to make additional attacks, and then dispels the darkness. Inside, a white blue wolf stands at the ready to attack.
The wolf moves forward and then howls an icey gale at Ronpip, Vimack, and Dorizoul. Dorizoul manages to protect her vitals, but Ronpip and Vimack take the full icey bite of the attack.
Ronpip backs up and conjures a barrage of spectral daggers at the wolf with one of the daggers he obtained from Asatir. Othorion drops his bow and goes into melee with the wolf, striking twice causing icey blood to freeze upon the ground nearby. Vimack knocks and arrow and fires a brambled arrow to the corner of the island, causing a bramble patch to bloom rapidly, reaching the wolf. He then concentrates on the wolf and marks it with Hunter's Mark. Evan speaks words of healing with Mass Healing Word to provide more health to the party, and allows Othorion to make additional attacks.
The wolf lunges at Othorion, gnashes him in her jaws as she shakes him with gore shakes, dropping him prone and bleeding. The priestess creates a portal near her and the cloaked figure, one of inky blackness that seems to tear a hole into the space.
Ronpip gathers eldritch energy in his blade, and fires it at the wolf, the damage causing the wolf to revert back into her humanoid form. She is looking like she is on her last legs. Ronpip then takes cover. Othorion crawls away while she is momentarily distracted. Vimack aims with his longbow, and fires one of the petrifying arrow, hitting her in the back. Slowly it turns her to stone, and she is petrified into a statue.
The cloaked figure and priestess step through the portal. And hostilities end.
Ronpip wants to get Othorion back to the Summerset Princess, but Evan and Vimack try to pillage the remains. Ronpip, now interested, cuts the head off of one of the dead assassins and takes a mask. They acquire some additional arrows for their quivers. Evan gives Othorion a Healing Potion in order to help with the gash in his side. Vimack tries to pick up a longbow, but it crumbles in his hand like weak ice. They pick up the wood elven guard and pack the bodies into the canoes. They drag the remaining bodies of the high elf assassins to the cliffside and drop them into the ocean for the fish to consume. They rip the staff out of the petrified druid's hand, breaking it in half(and thus causing it to lose its magic), before dumping her statued body into the ocean as well.
The party returns to the canoes to join Othorion, and they paddle back to Bryturdel. Othorion calls for guards to care for the bodies, and then takes the party back to the Summerset Princess to discuss the events and what to do further. Othorion vouches for the party's words and stands by them for their cause.
The party recalls that there is no emperor on the seat of Arcaedia, and the nobles are still fighting over it. Evan says he can convince his family to help, but he cannot vouch for the other noble houses, and one of his friends from the Noble House of Zepplin, Ledd has been hospitalized during this vie for power. He says he has good relations with the Noble House of Mumford and the Noble House of Bellion but does not have good diplomacy with the Noble House of Paramoure or the Noble House of Maroon. They come to an agreement for the Summerset Princess to have her send her militia to the Capital City, as long as the party can put someone in power to accept the militia as part of a defense against an invasion. She offers to allow them guided passage through the Fey Realm to the Capital, or offer them High Bred Forest Stags to get them to Thimbleville. The party decides to go to the Capital.
The party returns to an inn, drinking mead to relax after battle and exchanging stories to continue to build comradery between them. The party goes to bed, and Evan is pulled into a dreamscape, and finds himself with a strange blue humanoid creature who says his name is Nebun. He considers himself some sort of leader of the Scribes of Fidchelle, and demands Evan to stop meddling in affairs and perform as they were meant to. Observe and write. Nothing more. Evan, however, feels a conflict of interest.
The party awakens. Evan mentions he had a strange dream. Vimack mentions he dreamed of "his angel". And the party proceeds back to the Palace to utilize a fey portal and guide to get to The Capital quickly. She creates a portal within a nearby tree, and from within a beetle like creature will come out. She introduces it as Bumblebop who will guide them to the intended direction and destination. This portal feels different from their last time they travelled through.
Bumblebop guides them through, scaring away any fey that might bother them and makign sure the party keeps up with him. They come across a tree ent, that Bumblebop stops for, and the party discovers its Kenobade. He greets the party and then bids them good luck on their journey. They also come across another adventuring party along the way. They come upon a Hobo, A Pouty Half Elf, and a Lizardman who thinks he is a Dragonborn They exchange some words of encouragement and then move on. They come across the destination through the portal, and pass through. They did not arrive too far from the Capital but it will still take a bit of a walk. Bumblebop gives the party a parting salute, and goes back to the Fey Realm, where the portal to becomes a gnarled tree once more.
Evan sighs in relief of finally returning to urban civil society. Evan takes the party to the Southern Gate, pointing out places that he's visited just outside the walls with excitement. Once passed the gates, Evan wishes the party to come to his noble estate. Vimack is perturbed by the urban shaped trees and cut weeds the nobles use for their low cut fields. Evan leads the party to the gates of House Essence, and is greeted by his favourite butler Paul McCoy. Paul opens the gates for the party and leads them to the Mansion. Evan asks about the famaily; Paul says that his brother is away but everyone else is in house, including Evan's master Ed Sher'ran. The party must relieve themselves of their weapons at the entrance of the mansion. Evan decides to meet with his father, first and foremost. They enter his office, and he immediately offers his son a deep bear hug embrace. Evan introduces the party to his father, and he introduces himself as George Escence. After Evan describes his adventure, he also shares the dire need to set someone in power and asks about Ledd. His father shares as much as he knows, and calls upon a family meeting to have a proper discussion. Evan's mother joins first, then his sister who is very upset that he did not see her first, and while Evan tries to play up his return, his mother keeps things in scope, and respectfully recognize Evan is taking things a little more seriously since his departure a year ago. The family discusses current events among the noble houses. George reminds Evan is he becomes Emperor that his adventures end, and Evan states maybe he could still use his presence to check things out and bring out potential dark ends. George then goes on about the noble houses:

The Noble House of Escence has made a very substantial and successful business from alchemical practices related to person hygiene and cleaning rumored to have harsh labor practices
The Noble House of Van Halen have made their name through their diplomacy and social skills, though rumor has it they made a deal with a devil to obtain such diplomatic status.
The Noble House of Foo has made itself known as one of the best private security organizations with some of the best trained guardsmen gifted with Wuzhia lineage, but there is question of their loyalty since they are not entirely Arcaedian native.
The Noble House of Paramoure has control over the religious temples and districts; funding, caring, and employing them with various members. Though, such deep religious ties makes them an easy target for cult activity
The Noble House of Maroon were once famous explorers and are one of the oldest noble houses, tying back to the founding days of The Arcaedian Dominion with their cartography and scribes for Arcaedian history. Though, they have the lowest relationships with other houses.
The Noble House of Chevelle have a deep lineage of arcane practices and control the arcane schools of wizardry and libraries of arcane knowledge; though it is clear their lineage is taking a toll on them and people fear a curse has befell them.
The Noble House of Bellion has a monopoly on fine wines and culinary feasts, which makes them a target for black market ingredients, potentially even Canabalization.
The Noble House of Urie are information brokers, as well as one of the largest and richest houses in part of their well developed social status. They seek the throne most of all, especially Brand Diodah Urie
The Noble House of Mumford are a house of bards and have some of the best performances and performers across the land, some event hink they are blessed by some sort of god-like being.
He mentions that the net meeting of the noble houses is in two days, where Evan and party can see the chaos for themselves. With nothing more to discuss, Evan decides to seek out Ed Sher'ran, and George extends his house to the party as their own.
In the Grand Garden of House Escence, Ed Sher'ran is meditating in the garden. Evan summons My Immortal and they join in on the meditation. They exchange some fitting words, Ed believing Evan has grown stronger since he has last seen him. Evan introduces his friends. Evan believes his friends are better than he, but Ed Sher'ran disagrees, and wishes Evan to show him.
Evan proudly accepts the challenge. He and My Immortal pose up in battle preparation. Ed Sher'ran twists into a pose requiring incredible flexibility and summons EarthWindenFire, his own battle spirit. And the two prepare for battle in Session 10!
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 10
item.description:
Following Session 09 :
The session begins with Evan Escence facing off to the challenge by his master Ed Sher'ran. Meanwhile, Vimack Badger and Ronpip Thimble-bimble stand by to watch this play out. The two duke it out between their psionic manifestations and powers, displaying strange and erratic abilities that ultimately destroy the garden area. This attracts Evan's Mother's Attention and she too summons a psionic manifestation she calls Lacuna Coil, that causes Ed Sher'ran to cower in fear and dismiss his manifestation. Evan and Ronpip, too, is caught by surprise and can feel the menacing presence of Jacqueline Escence and her Lacuna Coil. Evan's Mother demands to know why they are destroying her yard, and Evan tries to explain the situation while Ed hides behind him in fear.
This is the first time Evan has seen his mother perform this. Ed reveals that Jacqueline had these powers on her own and was hired to train Evan, revealing Evan's lineage being that of a Kalashtar. He asks if his father is also Kalashtar, but she reveals he is nothing more than Human. She also explains that Evan is the only one who has it and that his siblings do not, and that the rest of Arcaedia does not know about this, and would prefer to keep it this way. Evan promises to clean up the place, while Ronpip and Vimack are showed to their guest rooms.
Meanwhile, Evan seeks reassurance from Ed, asking him if he should continue down the path of chosen by a god of scribes. But Ed declares that he should forge his own path, instead of taking one built for him.
He then has a dream overnight, once again taken by the Scribes of Fidchelle, and this time a group of them take him to a court room to judge him over what his actions may be. Evan surrenders the book and taunts them to make sure they take note of every detail. He awakens, seeing he can't summon the book. Instead, he decides to make his OWN book of arcane arts with the combination of his psionic powers.
The party has two days before they can meet with the other noble houses, and thus go about their own personal business.
Ronpip immediately heads over to The Arcaedian Postal Service in the Capital City, and writes two letters to Thimbleville. He then heads to the nearest market district. He notices some elves trying to cater to the commonfolk, handing off pendants that include a tooth. Ronpip acquires one at request, and then seeks out a blacksmith, specifically the blacksmith who sold him his original great sword. He finds the dwarf blacksmith, and requests a shield. They exchange wears, and Ronpip inquires about his new, magical sword. However, its clear the blacksmith is surprised to see the sword spawn from nowhere. When trying to handle the weapon, it seems like the blade weighs tens of times more than it appears. Ronpip is now doubly surprised. The interaction confuses the both of them, and they part with no further exchanges of wears or coin. He returns to the Escence Household and purchase a ham along the way.
Vimack decides he needs more nature in his life, and is recommended to visit one of the local parks to feel a bit more nature in the urban environment. There, he meets a peculiar Water Genasi who introduces herself as Lorellai who had dreams, which included Vimack, and possibly his companions. She requests him to gather his companions and join her on her quest, but Vimack needs to discuss it with his friends.
Evan runs down the stairs to share what he has completed over night. Ronpip shares concerns over High Elven activity in town and questions Lorellai's presence, though its very apparent she is an embodiment of innocence. They continue to question her, her intentions, and what she can do; enough so that Paul McCoy managed to cook the ham all the way through and serve it to the party. After a quick meal, Evan decides he needs to demonstrate what he can do. He turns Vimack small, which he takes advantage of to ride Dorizoul. He tries to have Lorellai to hit him to summon a shield, only she shatters his shield with the blow. He then has Paul McCoy gather him materials, and he begins the ritual to Find Familiar, in which Evan spawns a Flumph that he names Caesar Speedwagon. And continues to demonstrate through the day what he can do.
The following day, Evan heads out with Ronpip to visit Ledd. Together, they find Ledd completely pummelled from head to toe. Bruised and beaten and barely breathing, Ledd provides only a few words to the party before passing out: "Don't trust the moon" Once they leave the house, Ronpip shares with Evan the carved tooth that high elven speakers were exchanging to commoners in the market area. Ronpip casts Detect Magic and finds that its magical, showing a necromantic aura. Evan heads to the library seeking spells, but is finding that books are expensive. So instead he seeks scrolls! Remembering a magic shop, he heads out to a nearby market area, where he walks into the shop and spots a copper dragonborn named Rasul. He requests a Scroll of Identify and an offensive spell scroll if available. Rasul finds a scroll in his inventory and gives Evan a discount for his family's reputation, but cannot offer an offensive scroll at discount. Ronpip pulls the amulet of the carved tooth out and asks if Rasul cast Identify. He reveals that is called the Thrall's Neckpiece, and allows the wearer to deal magical necrotic damage and heal from it. It also seems to invoke a bloodthirst within the wearer.
