With nothing further needed, the two head back to the mansion. Evan rushes to his room to inscribe the spell into his book. Ronpip meanwhile stops by George's office to pull a book from their personal literature collection.
The following day, Paul McCoy announces that Evan Escence is invited to the Pillars of Archons where the noble houses will be meeting. Vimack questions if all of them should go, but Evan reminds him that Ledd was terribly beaten, and as far as the nobles are concerned, Evan is a weakling not worth even a low blow. Evan attempts to brief the group on etiquette while attending the meeting.
While traveling into the Pillars of Archons the party passes below the heroes of Vasaaros from its history. Evan reminds the party to keep an ear out on the other noble houses while the meeting is going on. Within, there is an open air hallway where royal guards stand at ready and nobles pass or gather. Evan and party is lead to a large open-air, decagonal chamber where a balcony is prepared for the Noble House of Escence, bearing its colours and insignia to identify him among the other houses. Each noble house has its own balcony decorated with their own colours as well, with Evan scanning to find the noblemen from the guards. An Judge of Arcaedia steps forward to a high seat within the chamber, that Evan recognizes as Tylos Laetios Mositia. Vimack puts on enough of a intimidating presence that it puts off most of the guards, except for one from the Noble House of Urie who is as big as Vimack. Tylos sits upon his mediators chair and introduces himself per tradition, with the chamber in silent anticipation. As soon as he finishes, the chamber breaks out in cacophony of chaos, with Tylos doing nothing to mediate given how often this has happened.
Evan listens to the best of his ability to try and make some sort of decision. Lorellai offers her divine sense to find good and evil among the crowd. Evan asks for her assistance. Lorellai detects partial fiends from Tieflings in the crowds, persons from the Noble House of Urie, Noble House of Van Halen and Noble House of Paramoure give off an aura of evil while the Noble House of Foo and Noble House of Chevelle show an aura of goodness about them. Evan takes note, Noble House of Foo has been silent the whole time, and takes a stand upon the ledge of his balcony and belts with with psionically amplified voice his case for himself to be chosen as emperor. He calls out the shamefulness of the houses for bickering for so long, and pushes his case further. The patriarch of the Noble House of Foo then stands and calls Evan out for his hypocrisy and grand standing when he left the city state for five years. Evan uses this as an attempted comeback, but the crowd is not swayed. Brand from the Noble House of Urie proclaims that his house has more than enough money to cover everything, and thus it should be him, countering that a worldly view truly sees a probable demise on its way. Evan stumbles a bit and confides with his friends, but Lorellai steps forward and pours her personal story and beliefs to the crowd, turning their hearts and heads towards Evan and the Noble House of Escence. Vimack notices that Noble House of Foo acknowledges the story subtly, and Brand is scowling at the spotlight being taken away from him.
Evan takes the chance to push further that uniting is the key to a successful rule, and that they all need to unite in order to overcome what will befall them. And that there should be proof to the people to gather the power of the people. Evan tries to guide the chambers into civility but Tylos lets him know that they've tried it, with a bit of vinegar in his voice. Evan then takes this moment to step forward again, and reveal that the High Elves are seeking to invade the Dominion, enslave humanity, and to continue to fight among themselves their job is only becoming easier for them. Tylos seems well persuaded by Evan's words, but a hooded priest in the Noble House of Paramoure has suddenly gone rigid and defensive.
Brand, out of nowhere, calls out to Tylos a Tullum Pugna Nula which is an ancient law which allowed the nobles to fight each other to the death for the masses. He does not believe his case, and dares to prove that Evan is nothing more than the smallest house while setting himself up for more power.
As per the tradition, the defendant is allowed to declare the terms of combat, while the prosecution chooses the location. Brand chooses the public amphitheater at the bottom of the hill beneath the Pillars of Archons, which will make it available for the most public eyes. Evan sets the terms to companions versus companions, no holds barred, and declares he is ready to see who will knock the other out first. Brand laughs and states it is to the death. Tylos slams his gavel, and declares the terms of combat determined, and the last of the house to stand is the house that stands.
The party goes shopping for last minute requirements before proceeding to the amphitheater that will act as their arena. To Ronpip's surprise, Paul is with them, but he assures Ronpip that he is there to protect Evan, just as he was instructed to since Evan was born. With four companions with Evan and four companions with Brand, the two groups strut out to present themselves. The public are doing their best to get as much of a view as possible with the noble houses seated in lifted structures to allow them to see the action. Tylos will come to the edge of the amphitheater and relay the terms of combat to them, letting the feeling of death weigh in on Evan and Brand. He calls upon Evan, and Evan struts with Style and gets some wow from the crowd. Brand is called forward, and he imitates Evan's strut. Tylos calls for the two to shake, which Evan extends a hand and Brand swats it away. Evan mutters his revenge while Brand foretells his end. The two return to their groups. Tylos unsheathes his sword, raises it to the air...
Evan then reminds Vimack about the dog he loved that was killed, and reveals that it was Brand who did it. This immediately triggers Vimack, who is now out for blood.
...and with a shimmering swing of his sword, cuts down with a beam of light to begin combat. Brand strikes a pose, and announces that he knows Evan's secrets, and reveals his own Psionic Battle Spirit, King of the Clouds. Evan summons My Immortal. Ronpip summons his sword. Vimack rages. Lorellai readies her flail and shield.
And trial by combat commences... into Session 11
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 11
item.description:
Following Session 10 :
Evan Escence takes on the Tullum Pugna Nula requested by Brand Diodah Urie, taking him and his companions, Vimack Badger, Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Lorellai, and Paul McCoy to the amphitheater that acts as their arena to face off against Brand and his own allies. Tylos initiates the combat to begin, and the two parties attack.
Ronpip immediately summons the Tool of War and casts Shatter upon the closest member of Brand's group. A red dragonborn rips his cloak off and charges towards Ronpip, but Ronpip is too quick with his Greatsword. With intensity, he attacks Ronpip again, and manages to get a strike in, though Ronpip parries the attack to lessen its blow. Next, a cloaked Half-Elf dashes in and strikes at Ronpip, summoning green flames across his blade.
DOWNED Ronpip is incapacitated from the strike!
Vimack spawns an area of thorns and spikes upon the ground before Brand's group, making it difficult for them to move. A human with a mace and shield climbs through the Spike Growth and waves a hand, sending a wave of necrotic energy at Vimack. Paul stays where he is and prepares. Brand and King of the Clouds send a wave of psychic energy across Evan's party, causing Vimack to nearly hit Dorizoul and also causes him to feel frightened of Brand and his menacing presence. The Tiefling Wizard casts a red hot beam of energy at Paul. Evan casts Mystic Missile at several targets, infusing his arcane missiles with his psionic influence. The Cleric is hit and is Charmed, seeing Evan as an ally. The Figher is hit and is Dazed. The Rogue manages to overcome the effects but is still damaged by the spell. Lorellai begins a Prayer of Healing and heals her allies from the initial hits. Ronpip is revived, and tosses his blade at the rogue who promptly dodges it. He then moves out of the way, with a plan in mind. The Red Dragonborn has to shake his head and recover from the Dazed blow. Vimack compels himself, brings himself to a rage, and fires from his longbow at Brand, missing one shot but hitting with his second shot. He then whistles and Dorizoul charges arcane energy into her mouth and releases it, hitting Brand, the Cleric, and the Red Dragonborn with a flurry of arcane missiles. The Cleric attempts to move forward to attack the Arcane Wyvern, but ends up stabbing himself and is too weak to get through the floor of bramble and thorns. Paul gets confirmation from Evan to proceed, and then proceeds to attack the red dragonborn with a surprising amount of speed, only hitting once but hitting with enough force to Stun him. Brand points at Paul and puts him in a state of shock with the illusion of Evan dying. The Tiefling Wizard makes a sign of the shadows, and summons a Hound of Ill Omen from his own shadow to target Evan, which then sprints through the brambles and thorns to get to him. He attempts to then summon the weave to cast Fireball but Evan uses Counterspell to rip the arcane energy away from the Wizard. Evan takes up The Talisman of Pure Good and attempts to send Brand straight to hell, but Brand absconds from it and is unaffected. Lorellai rushes in, and attacks the red dragonborn, smiting with her flail in hand twice, and then shield bashes into him into the brambles and thorns, knocking him out of combat. The Hound of Ill Omen charges Evan, and locks its jaw into his arm, pulling him to the ground Prone. Ronpip Pulls out his shield while tossing a dagger, using it to Conjure Barrage, striking Brand and his lackeys with spectral daggers. He then hops on to Dorizoul and summons his sword to his hands, willing it into a lance as it reforms. The rogue dives through the brambles and attacks Lorellai quickly to then disengage into a better position for himself. Vimack drops his bow and pulls out his second sword to attack the Hound of Ill Omen that is attacking Evan.
CRITICAL HIT! Vimack manages to strike the Hound of Ill Omen with a reckless critical strike and strikes it with lightning!
Paul runs to Evan's aid, and hits the rogue with a flurry of unarmed strikes, hitting the Swashbuckler three times and knocking them out of the fight! Brand creates a whirlwind around him, and flies over the brambles. He channels psionic energies, and blasts an intense gust of wind to knock Ronpip and Dorizoul away, but it does nothing to the wyvern or gnome. The Tiefling Wizard bites his thumb and creates a demonic circle upon the ground in blood. It opens up, and a fiendish hand reaches up from the abyss and climbs out. Ronpip recognizes that its not an arcane spell. Lorellai recognizes it as a Summon Lesser Demon spell. Vimack sees in the crowd a particular noble performing subtle arcane gestures. Evan from the ground casts Mystic Missile. The Hound of Ill Omen is struck and receives a sudden wave of Exhaustion. The demon and the wizard are hit, with the wizard falling to the ground from the hit. Evan then has Caesar move towards Brand but the stench of the fiend causes it to feel suddenly sick. Still, it reaches over to Brand and Evan channels Shocking Grasp through it. He tries to get up to his feet, but the Hound of Ill Omen keeps Evan to the ground. Lorellai rushes at Hezrou, passing through the waft of the demon's stench. She strikes at it with her flail, though her strikes seem to do little damage, her holy smites seem to hit for a lot. She then bashes it with her shield. The Hound of Ill Omen mauls Evan while he remains locked to the ground. The summoned fiend attacks wide, swiping for Lorellai, Dorizoul, and Ronpip, though Dorizoul and Lorellai manage to get out of the way. Ronpip draws upon the magic of the Tool of War and gives himself temporary vigor while also stilling his warrior soul for real vigor. Then, with intensity in a surge of energy, he attacks Brand with his lance and channels Booming Blade through it but Brand dramatically dodges out of the way of the attacks. Vimack dives in at the Hound of Ill Omen recklessly.
CRITICAL STRIKES! Both swords come in and cross section into the Hound of Ill Omen, lifting it off the ground and forcing it to dissipate in shadowy smoke.
Vimack then moves to the edge of the arena, and tries to call out the noble who was making the arcane gestures he was noticing. But the noble does not expose themselves, and Tylos is getting concerned of Vimack's actions. Vimack tries to explain his actions to Tylos, but Tylos is not convinced and is prepping to be defensive, turning Vimack back to the battle and implying consequences to the alternative. Paul helps Evan stand up from being mauled by the Hound of Ill Omen. Brand is mad that the Flumph shocked him, and flicks Caesar with psychic energy, obliterating it.
Fail Caesar was killed in battle.
Brand then uses his Psionic Energy to cloak himself in a spinning funnel of air. Lorellai tries to maneuver away from the fiend, but it sees an opportunity to bite into her. Evan draws upon psionic energies and casts a beam of Radiant energies at the summoned demon, blinding it and forcing it to let her go. Lorellai dives in to hit Brand, misses and he manipulates the flail to hit her back, but it misses her. She shifts her weight and hits the summoned demon instead, smiting it across the side. The summoned demon, enraged by the blinding effect, tries to maneuver towards Evan, or where it felt it was being shot at. Ronpip and Lorellai take advantage of its lapse in judgement and strike! Lorellai manages to get a strike and smite in.
CRITICAL STRIKE! Ronpip manages to strike in with his lance into a vital area.
The summoned fiend lashes out to the general area of Evan, but misses with its wild strikes. Ronpip goes after Brand again with Booming Blade channeling upon the lance. Brand has to swiftly dodge as Ronpip is starting to read his movements, and the second jab catches him, striking into his shoulder and enveloping him with sonic energy. Tylos and Evan tell Vimack to get back into the fight. Vimack is still angry about the noble interfering and climbs off the stage. Tylos draws his sword and takes an attack against Vimack, but Vimack swipes it away with a short sword and proceeds towards the noble. He tries to reason angrily with the noble to dispel the summoning, but the noble ignores him to the best of their ability. He returns to the stage upset, and gets close to the summoned fiend, striking it with the collected static charge within his body. Brand lashes into Ronpip's mind with a psionic whip. Evan moves away from the summoned demon, and it tries to take a swipe at the movement. My Immortal comes in and shields Evan from the bite. Evan draws upon his psionic energy and tries to shove Brand. He stands his ground and is unmoved but is still pummeled by the force of the blow. Lorellai moves away from Brand, and Brand takes a swipe at her with his axe, gashing into her armor and his gauntlets channel psychic energy into her, knocking her out of the fight. The summoned fiend goes for Vimack as he is the biggest and closest target. In its wild strikes, its claws rake across Vimack but he gets out of the way of its bite. Ronpip continues to pierce at Brand, adjusting into a Precision Strike, hitting him and once again dousing him in sonic energy.
Ronpip Kills Brand Ronpip strikes him directly into the eye, channeling his sonic energy into his head, and causes his head to explode.
Before he died, Brand stumble about and states He his future was to become the Emperor, "Madame Darlayia predicted it! She promised me a crowd, the wine would run through the streets" as his entire head explodes.
The demon finds itself unsummoned, trying to claw its self back to the material plane but gets sucked away.
Tylos then declares that Evan of the Noble House of Escence has won the battle. Ronpip is sickened by the cheers and the aftermath. Vimack is in a battle rush, cheering with Evan by picking him up, before they realize that Lorellai is bleeding out on the ground. Ronpip rides Dorizoul to Lorellai, and with a Healer's Kit stabilizes her. Vimack angrily picks her up. Evan plays up the victory with some effects, before realizing that his friends are extremely upset and wish to leave. Tylos congratulates Evan for his victory, and reveals that the Noble House of Escence now takes all from the Noble House of Urie, merging in favor to the Noble House of Escence. Evan is stunned and pleased, though Ronpip reminds him that its less people now to help the country. Evan asks about a healer for Lorellai and Tylos gives healing through his hand into Lorellai. She awakens with a startle but Vimack, although angry, keeps her calm.
The party looks into the remains of Brand's companions. Brand's has some unique Bracers that intrigue Evan. The Tiefling Wizard has a Wand of Fireballs. The red dragonborn is wearing Smoldering Plate Armor and dons Burning Gauntlets. The Rogue is wearing Speedy Boots. The Cleric has a Necklace of Prayer Beads.
Evan wishes to go see what he has inherited. Ronpip stares at the dead bodies and contemplates his lance. Paul accompanies Vimack and Lorellai back to the Escence Estate. Ronpip joins them after having a momentary discussion with the Tool of War. Evan gives Vimack the spoils to Identify later. Vimack is still upset about the summoned demon and huffs off when it seems Evan does not know what happened.
Evan heads to the Financial District to discuss the acquired assets. Evan explains the situation to an associated, who takes him to a private room while they collect the paperwork pertaining to the Noble House of Urie.
Meanwhile, Ronpip and Vimack discuss what he saw; Lorellai is kicking in his arms. Vimack states he saw one of the nobles in the audience summoned the demon and continues to be angry. Until he starts to hear some soft singing in Giant on the wind. He calms himself so that he can gather a better direction of the song. He breaks off from the group and goes towards the song. Paul takes Ronpip and Lorellai back to the manor.
Vimack continues to wander through town to find the source of the song alongside with Dorizoul.
A halfling enters the private with Evan. A cart of papers follow him in. The halfling has a distinct level of concern in his voice but Evan takes no immediate notice. The halfling tells Evan that the Noble House of Urie has a substantial bank of gold under their name, but also substantial debt that is now under the responsibility of the Noble House of Escence. Evan signs off on the exchange and heads back home.
Vimack has been tracking the song that is currently taunting him. He reaches the north eastern part of town, coming upon a bridge where Dorizoul is standing there, oddly alone without her followers and unarmed. Vimack calls out to her, and though she does not give apparent heed, she hears him. Vimack sees that she is staring into the water below. Vimack inquires what she is doing here, and she explains that this was part of The Pilgrimage of Giants that the Old Ones took. She informs him that the district is called Pilgrim's End, and the bridge Lover's Crossing, related to the tale of two Frost Giant Lovers from opposing mountains who could not be together. She is cryptic during the entire exchange but Vimack is catching on. She makes an odd request for Vimack to deliver a stone ring to a hole stone hiding within the canal below the bridge. Vimack takes the ring and dives into the water. The current is strong and is beginning to pull Vimack away from the bridge. Though the water obscures his vision, he sees a standing stone with a hole, and swims towards it. He drops off the ring within the hole. It disintegrates from his hand, the hole stone and glows with Goliath runes, striking his hand with light, and deep dark blue tattoos come from his hand and finger. Suddenly, he feels where North is at all time and has a sensation of the lover's embrace. He returns to the bridge, coughing water out but returns nonetheless. Dorizoul is no longer at the bridge, which saddens Vimack. Though he notices a piece of wood with giant's runes carved into it reading, "Hope to see you again..." With nothing more needed, he heads back to the manor.
The party regathers at the manor and tries to redetermine what they want to do. Evan would like to Identify the magic items they acquired while the party rests at the Ecsence manor. Evan starts with the gauntlets, and find they are the Evan starts With the gauntlets, and find they are the Gauntlets of Heavenly Ascension. He finds the wand of fireballs is in fact the Wand of Fireballs. Boots of Speed. The Steel Gauntlets are the Gauntlets of Flaming Fury.
Following the next day, a messenger from the Noble House of Foo arrives at the Escence manor, requesting him and the party to visit the estate of the Noble House of Foo at their earliest behest. Vimack has been stewing about the noble who interfered with the battle, and finally connects the dots between the noble and the colors of the house they were associated with. Together, they plan for the next day of Session 12...
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 12
item.description:
Following Session 11 :
Note This Session was a large mix of low rolls, and misinformation and from the DM. Especially at the end.
Evan Escence, Vimack Badger, and Ronpip Thimble-bimble are eating breakfast at the Escence manor. Evan lets the party know that they have been invited to the Noble House of Foo. Vimack chimes in and asks about the house's colors, which Evan relays is not the same as the one is he troubled by. Lorellai has a stomach ache so that she can be removed from the session for the time. Evan and crew reach the Noble House of Foo's estate and find that the estate is different from the other noble estates, have a very apparent Eastern style. Evan sees a funny opportunity to fondly the brass gate knockers, but ends up lifting them out of their holders. He ends up throwing them behind him, and Vimack tries to catch it on the way, but its weight causes it to slip through his fingers and crash into the ground. A servant greets them at the gate, accepts the apology for the knocker, and takes the party to Duan Ping, the Patron of the house. Along the way, Vimack is concerned that Evan cannot hold a sword properly. Evan mentions he only ever held one for play, which confuses Vimack and Ronpip. Vimack takes out a sword, and hands it over to Evan, who promptly takes it. Vimack and Ronpip are appalled, and they have to get him to adjust.
The servant opens the sliding door, and Duan Ping is sitting at a table with tea. He welcomes to join him at the table. He speaks in Wuzhia to a servant to have them close the door and make sure the area is clear from listeners. Duan lets the party know that some elders of his house have been exchanging treasonous information between the Arcaedian government and Wuzhia. Evan asks why its a problem, and Duan puts in the weight of the situation. Evan then asks how he found out this information, and he mentions his mother, Yin Lei, was berating another elder of the house, Xun Fen. He also believes a different elder, Qui Chun, has been doing odd dealings with Wuzhia sailors. Lastly, he had his servants recover documents revealing payments to royal healers, but not for any healing. Evan speaks aloud about how they are beginning to believe the former emperor of Arcaedia was assassinated. Duan wants the party to try and investigate with as little commotion as possible, feeling that his house is not worthy to take the throne and that his own house is against him. The party shares that the High Elves are also intending to invade, and exchange their tale of the summerset kingdom. Duan believes the party, and promises that if the party can help him, he will help them. He suspects all three suspects believe Duan knows and refuse to be present when he is around. He congrats the party on their victory against the Noble House of Urie. He pulls Evan aside for a moment and tells him to keep away from Gau Meng.
The party first heads to the Pillars of Archons, where the noble meeting was held. Vimack and Ronpip try to use GET HELP to try and maybe reach the royal healers directly, but a Judge of Arcaedia comes in and Lay on Hands to heal Ronpip, thwarting the initial plan. The party instead wanders the halls of the Pillars of Archons, and upon finding the healer's area, continue to deliberate on what to do. Vimack knocks on the healer's door, but find no one answers and the door is locked. Ronpip casts Dimension Door to get passed the door. Ronpip hears that Vimack is putting the crowbar into the door, and stops him. He slowly investigates the area but finds he is ill equipped for the situation. He pops back to the party and explains the door is locked on both sides. They go back to the crowbar plan, but Vimack fails to open the door and Ronpip catches the sounds of Judges walking by. Vimack tries again after they pass by, but the door does not give. Vimack and Evan split and talk to separate Judges, asking about the healers and why the area was closed. They explain that the healers were sent home since there was no emperor.
The party heads over to the Eastern dock, where Wuzhian trading ships are more likely to dock. The group finds themselves at the Leifell Harbour, where they find a few ship of Wuzhian in origin which all fly the same bronze dragon across their sails and flags. The come to find a Copper Dragonborn seems to be the admiral to those group of ships at dock. Evan goes to speak to him and he introduces himself as Zhi. Evan has a typical conversation with a mercantile sir, but then insinuates that he might have a secret stock of something, which bothers Zhi and he immediately threatens him. Vimack tries to save face but fails; Ronpip points out a odded out person of Wuzhia origin working with sailors to stock a warehouse. After the sailors finish and they close the warehouse doors, the party moves in to investigate. Evan goes wings and takes Ronpip up to the second floor barn doors. He climbs in and spies upon the men inside, who have become weary of the sudden noises from the roof and doors. Things don't go the way that the party needs, and have to flee.
The party returns to the manor in order to come up with a new plan on how to fulfill their quest. They take a long rest for Ronpip's sake, and plan to return to the Royal Healer's area while at night. They casually walk into the Pillars of Archons and Evan casts Knock upon the door to unlock it. The party then investigates the area. Evan discovers that the Noble House of Paramoure has been requesting more physicians than usual at the Cathedral of Stars. Ronpip discovers the Noble House of Chevelle have been requesting large amounts of heavy narcotics and pain killing medicines and the Noble House of Van Halen has been monthly obtaining exotic medicines. Evan finds a medical journal that includes an entry mentioning "the former emperor was poisoned by something foreign to Arcaedia". They have what they think they need and set out on their next objective.
They return to the docks to check out the warehouse again. Ronpip manages to get in the same way as before, and finds the warehouse has been emptied. They investigate the inside, and Ronpip discovers an illusory floor covering a trap door leading to a basement underneath the warehouse. The illusory floor fizzles out when they open the trap door, and within, there is a pitch dark room with thin shelves with boxes labelled with the mark of The Shadow Snappers. Inside the crates, they find glass vials of some sort of strong toxin, that Ronpip accidentally samples. They scour the rest of the boxes and find numerous amounts of contraband. While discussing how to handle the discovery, they hear footsteps enter the warehouse. Evan creates the smell of a skunk to try and get them to go away, but the scent makes them worry the wares have gone bad. The footsteps come closer faster, and Evan creates magical darkness to hide them. The two investigators enter, and find they can't see anything. They retreat, and Evan attempts to close the crates they had opened and return them, being the only one able to see within his own magical darkness. When the person returns down the stairs, Evan tries to create a delusion within the enterer's mind, creating the sound of of the barn door above from closing. He begins to rustle for something in a bag, and he pulls out a lit hooded lantern that seems to pierce through the magical darkness.
Ronpip aims his sword at the light source, and fires two beams of Eldritch Blast through his sword. Evan lobs Mystic Missiles at the two perpetrators, causing one to suddenly feel a wave of despair, and the other to feel enraged and smack his friend. Vimack rages and tosses the shelves nearest to him. The three of them manage to exit the room and drop the trapdoor. They hear lots of screaming from within, and Evan dispels the magical darkness, and Ronpip sees the two victimized by the drugs and toxins in the worst overdose he could witness. While trying to escape, Vimack wonders what happened to them, and with Ronpip's desire to leave quickly, Vimack does not want to leave them behind. He makes it back to the trapdoor, and cannot see or hear anything going down there. Before he can rush down there, Evan summons a psionic wall to stop him, and warns him this is the consequences of working for The Beak. Vimack is stopped, but is clearly very upset at the results of their actions. And with nothing more to do with the warehouse, they return to Evan's manor.
Vimack desires a bath and asks Paul if he may set one up. Evan wishes to join and Ronpip decides it would be good to join as well. Vimack abuses his ability to breathe underwater to stew over his actions. Evan and Ronpip become concerned and attempt various things to get him to return to the surface. They eventually coerce him to return to the surface and confront them about this ability. Though Vimack is still hard pressed about his actions...
Until Session 13!
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 13
item.description:
Following Session 12:
Lorellai has overcome her stomach ache and can now rejoin the party with Evan Escence, Vimack Badger, and Ronpip Thimble-bimble. While she was away, she had a fever dream about the city of Vasaaros devestated into destruction, with a white raven surrounded by a cloud of ravens, and a cloud of bats coming from the north led by a stark white bat.
The group decides to head back to the Pillars of Archons in an attempt to find and interrogate Xun Fen. Evan speaks to a local royal guard in order to get directions towards the royal advisor's office, and obtain directions. They find the office, and Xun Fen suggests he is busy and cannot be bothered, but Evan says he wants to discuss the debt owed by the Noble House of Urie. After welcomed in, Evan repeats his reason for the visit, but Xun Fen wants to see the documentation. Evan has to use Delusion in order to convince Xun Fen he actually has any paperwork in his possession. However, Xun Fen is not taking to the lie, and points out to the paperwork on his desk that he is extremely busy. Evan tries to cause a bit of chaos by pulling on the paperwork at his desk, but Xen Fen manages to catch his hand, with Evan noticing he is very quick and his grip is very strong. When things have calmed slightly, Ronpip shares with Xun Fen that the high elves are intending to invade.
Critical Success Ronpip's information has persuaded Xun Fen, and he believes his story
However, Ronpip noticed that Xun Fen is rather overly accepting of this information, as he does not seem particularly bothered that armies are headed towards Vasaaros. They try to call on his suspicious calmness, though he argues a person who is now in charge needs to remain calm at all times for a level head. Ronpip mentions that they visited with Noble House of Foo, and that Duan Ping mentioned Yin Lei spoke very highly of him. Though these comments do not seem to phase his integrity. Vimack keeps an eye on his micro expressions and sees that the information about the invasion seems to be working in his head on how he can benefit from it. Vimack then inquires how the emperor passed, which Xun Fen quickly answers that it was natural from old age. Evan implies that the high elves poisoned him, though Ronpip and Xun Fen refute that idea. Vimack then puts out the idea that someone close to him could have dispatched him quiet to be put into a place of power, and he noticed Xun Fen is suddenly very on guard. Vimack then implies a level of blackmail.
Critical Success Xun Fen is starting to fear for his life and position; and its beginning to surface with some sweat upon his brow and his heart rate and pressure increasing.
Ronpip points out that when Vimack gets this way, it only goes well if the victim is honest. Xun Fen seems willing to hear his options if he is unable to escape the situation. Vimack implies that they should calmly open the room to discussion, and Lorellai mentions rumors of treachery about Xun Fen
Xun Fen immediately calms, seeming to be fully convinced now that the party knows nothing. He is able to refute all further accusations towards him, and is done having the party waste his time and asks the party to leave before he has to call the guard. Vimack tries to bring the conversation back to poisoning the emperor, but Xun Fen is unbothered, and warns again that the party should leave before he calls the guard. Evan opens up that Qui Chun has a warehouse he frequents that had poisons hidden away in a secret basement but he refutes that the party has any proof and its a convenient rumor. He is beginning to become aggravated by the party but does not want to instill violence in his office, so continues to warn he will call upon the guards if the party continues to harass him. Vimack has some final words, and then the party exits the office. Evan spends some of his psionic energy to knock some of the papers over in a final petty action.
The party retreats nearby and hatch a secondary plan. Ronpip sticks behind to watch the office door, and the party wanders. Half an hour later, they return and Ronpip points out he's been picking up papers for the passed half hour. Vimack takes the watch and the next half hour passes with nothing happens. Lorellai makes herself invisible and gets closer to the door while the rest of the party wanders for the next half hour. A servant comes down the hall with a tray, and Lorellai moves out of his way to then sneak into the room behind the servant. Xun Fen is continuing to write paperwork, waves the servant off who delivers the tray, and the servant leaves. Lorellai finds herself in a moment of anxiety as she is now alone and must make a decision for herself. Xun Fen pours himself tea completely unaware of Lorellai's presence. Lorellai slowly investigates his office, trying to find something she could take with her. There is a lock box on his shelf, open, that contains letters and scrolls not of Arcaedian origin. She reaches in and carefully tucks some of the scrolls into her armor. Lorellai is once again in a moment of anxiety as to if she should look further or exit, or how to exit the office. She sneaks to the door, and exits, seemingly with no problem. She then runs to go find them, though ends up running along their original patrol route. Vimack, Evan, and Ronpip return to their stake out position, and Lorellai is not to be found. Ronpip attempts to Detect Magic and does not detect any traces of an invisible being. Evan channels psionic energy into his eyes to see invisible creatures, but sees no one. He tries to channel his now Perfect Senses to try and track her but cannot find any method to track her. Ronpip and Evan head down their patrol route, and Vimack lingers behind. A now visible Lorellai appears before Vimack, and says they should leave to talk about what she find.
Eventually the party manages to finally meet up with each other. They decide now is a good time to head back to Duan Ping and relay their findings. However, upon arriving, they notice the streets are oddly empty, and upon approaching the gates of Foo's main estate, Gau Meng steps out from a corner and blocks their way. He tells them they know that they are investigating their house, to return to their own manor, and to not attempt to enter the estate or speak to any Foo members hence forth. Multiple monks hop over the walls, hidden from sight, and brandish their weapons in a show or power and intimidation, showing the party is heavily out numbered and possible out matched. The party is not nervous about being ambushed and surrounded, and they agree they could go home but look to Evan for where to go. Evan, openly, states the party should return to his house, and the party exits through the open way the ambushers have left open for them.
A ways away, they discuss what they know and the possibilities of Duan Ping being in danger, considering the show of force. Evan wants to sneak into the estate in order to get a quick talk to Duan Ping, but Ronpip suggests actually getting the scrolls that Lorellai managed to steal translated, either to see their usefulness or to know for himself what is in the scrolls. The party returns to Escence Manor, concerned they are being spied upon and their next move will be predicted again. Evan tries to see if his immediate family can speak Draconic, but no one available can translate the language. Evan takes the party back to the dragonborn that sold him the Spell Scrolls. The party attempts to hide the source of the scrolls from him, and Evan manages to persuade him but he feels odd about them because they are Wuzhia in origin and not magic scrolls. Lorellai asks if he may know someone who could help them. Rasul says he knows a guy on the western shanty town the locals call Shanty Town Citicounty, but he's a grumpy fellow and is unsure how helpful he would actually be, but Lorellai is confident they can handle grumpy. Lorellai inquires if there is something they could tribute to him to lighten his mood, and Rasul suggests the largest fish they can catch.
Vimack dives into the nearest harbor and rage fishes to catch the largest fish in the lake, and manages to rage grapple a supremely large fish from the deep of the lake worth 160 lbs. Its eight at night when the party arrives to Shanty Town Citicounty, eyeing Vimack and the giant fish. They knock on the door of the suggested helper, trying to deliver the fish. Inside, a heavily aged Brass Dragonborn showing heavy oxidation across his metallic scales demands what they want. The party lets him know they need some scrolls translated, and are willing to trade the 160 lb fish for his service. With due haste, he lets them in and demands them to drop off the fish. While the brass dragonborn is hoping to chow down as soon as possible, Vimack barters that the scrolls to be translated first. The brass dragonborn begins to read and translates, though the dialect is strange to him. After his initial translation, he seems to forget why the fish was given to him. Vimack sees an opportunity to get him to translate multiple times considering the dialect is strange to him.
Roughly, he gets:

*"The country to the east wanting to know about the emperor"
*"Stone queen interested in knowing who the new emperor is"
*"Weakening the empire"
*"Weakening the emperor"
*"Weakening the continent" (of Arcaedia)
*"Crystal Empress wanting to know who the king is"
*"Dethroning the tree... the pillar? Uprooting the pillar?? Desaturating... the hero"
Vimack thanks him for his service, and leaves a note for him including his name and "From House Escence" on it, with the party including their names and "Contact for help." They finally ask him his name, and he says his name is Brassy. The party leaves and lets Brassy enjoy his fish.
The party regathers, and decide that the cover of dark is a good time to try and infiltrate the Foo estate, and reach Duan Ping in secret to relay him the information he requested. They decide to have Evan be eyes in the sky while Ronpip is turned invisible to enter the estate.
The sneak into the night of the area associated with the Noble House of Foo. When they are within sight but still far, they begin to cook their plan into motion. They notice a some patrols outside the walls of the estate. Evan suggests taking Ronpip to the air and dropping him overhead, casting Feather Fall just before he hits the ground. Lorellai casts Invisibility on Ronpip, and he becomes unseen. Evan lifts off up to the air with Ronpip in hand, rising 120 ft above the estate, and drops Ronpip. He waits for a moment, and casts Feather Fall, but realizes he cannot see Ronpip. Ronpip notices he is not slowing down, summons the Tool of War as a short sword, and tosses it from above into a set of bushes, and teleports to it. Unfortunately, this causes him to become visible again. He dismisses the Tool of War and has alerted a patrol within the estate. Ronpip uses his Silent Image to draw attention away from where he landed, and the dull sound of hammered alarms going off into Session 14.
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 14
item.description:
Following Session 13:
Evan Escence, Vimack Badger, Lorellai, and Ronpip Thimble-bimble seek to infiltrate the House Foo estate at night in an attempt to deliver information to Duan Ping. Ronpip has been sky dropped by Evan from above, in a failed attempt to Feather Fall an Invisible Gnome.
Ronpip creates an illusion of a cloaked figure to capture the inside patrol's attention. He moves the Silent Image towards the wall as though he is fleeing. Evan shifts his coloration to be darker so that he is less apparent while in flight. He watches overhead, and sees that there are several patrols both inside the walls outside of the house, and outside the walls of the estate. The patrols within the walls have been alarmed and are chasing after the Silent Image. They try to capture it in a triangulated attack as it dives into the bush, but find that their staffs pass through it, and appear to be confused. Vimack and Lorellai notice that the nearest outside patrol is alerted to something, and Vimack feels an overwhelming sense of disappointment. Vimack begins to approach the patrol, though his disappointment distracts him from being stealthy, while Dorizoul keeps up with him quietly. Lorellai keeps up as well, just as loud. The patrol sees them, and move towards the gate and face down Vimack and Lorellai who seem to be approaching quite aggressively.
Meanwhile, inside, Ronpip sneaks between bushes while the inward patrols are distracted by his Silent Image. Evan is still trying to search for Ronpip, and channels energy into his eyes to give him dark vision. He lands on the roof, knocking off a tile and quickly casts Feather Fall on the roof tile before it can expose his position, and potentially put Ronpip in danger.
Vimack maintains the distraction of the outside patrols, using his new tattoo to channel arcane energy as he rages, and frost begins to build at one of the patrolmen's legs. Lorellai aims her shield at the same patrolman, and a beam of dark green energy, and he is visibly weakened from the attack. The patrol outside surrounds Vimack and collectively try to grapple and apprehend Vimack, imprisoning him in a prison of boa staffs, restraining him.
Evan has taken notice to this, and attempts to distract the patrols inside the estate walls. He summons two shadows that take the form of My Immortal. The patrols are now on high alert as they are suddenly being attacked by monsters. They go in to quickly engage the monsters and destroy one of them, and now they seemed concerned someone is summoning things into their estate. A patrol then spots Evan upon the roof, and throw ninja stars at him.
Vimack calls upon his Animated Shield, which pushes a staff just out of the way, weakening the interlocking hold and giving Vimack just enough wiggle room to throw the staves off of him. Lorellai draws upon her watery origin and summons an ice knife, and tosses it into the fight. It explodes in icey shards, and Vimack has to cast Absorb Elements as a reaction, while the patrol dodges out of the way. Vimack tries to shove the nearest patrolmen but he manages to get out of the way. He tries to rush through them but they hold him back with Attacks of Opportunity and prevent him from getting passed him. More patrols outside are sprinting with incredible speed to meet up with Vimack and Lorellai. They come in and grapple Vimack, but are unable to restrain him just yet.
The remaining shadow moves out and attacks at one patrolman, who is caught off guard. It swipes at him, damaging him and draining some of his strength from him. Evan begins to channel psionic energy and spawns a 60ft radius sphere of "magical" darkness upon the ground, protecting Ronpip from being spotted further. Ronpip has seen everything that is going on, and decides to wait things out for a moment. The patrols throw more throwing stars at Evan, three hitting him in the shadows, and then exit the sphere of darkness momentarily. Evan, pained by the stars, loses his concentration on the darkness, and the shadows dissipate.
Outside, Vimack breaks the grapple. Lorellai goes in for the attack, performing the 1-2-3 combo including her shield to attack, but the patrolman manages to divert her flail attacks out of the way with their staff, but when the shield comes in, he blow knocks him back and he has to recover from the sudden shove backwards. One guy is knocked down into another and they are knocked prone. One of the patrols tries to lock down Dorizoul but she easily hopes over his sweep. The two Lorellai knocked down spin and rise to their feet and go after Lorellai, and she misses with her Opportunity Attack, and they attempt to grapple her, but Lorellai keeps her swings wide to keep them from getting into a lock down condition.
Inside, Evan is being accosted by the patrol that has climbed to the roof to meet Evan. Evan channels the sphere of darkness again, this time centered on himself. Meanwhile, on the ground, Ronpip clicks his boots to increase his movement, and he sneaks below under a bush rather quickly. Evan has attracted a majority of the patrols to the roof, and they all attempt to lob throwing stars into the darkness to where they believe Evan was. Evan can hear the throwing stars whiz passed his head and body, and he reactively casts Shield, blocking the one who manages to hit him. From what little he can see, he can see the patrol watch as a single throwing star bounces back and rolls off the roof.
Lorellai goes in for the attack, swinging her flail and catching a patrolman off guard with the flail's chain. Dorizoul disengages and Vimack casts Spike Growth. The patrol go back in to grapple Lorellai, and they manage to catch Lorellai between swings and lock her down. The ones facing Vimack take a standing leap, impressing Vimack as they leap roughly 8ft into the air straight over him. They go in for the attack.
Ronpip continues to sneak towards the estate in a bush. He opens the sliding door. Evan Misty Steps off the roof, and the patrol in the darkness dive into its center to try and apprehend Evan from last they saw him.
Dorizoul rushes in for a Trample and she tramples some patrolmen who do not expect her to rush in. Lorellai does not break the grapple but attacks while grappled, beating upon the patrolmen who have her pinned. Vimack, not wanting the patrol to be killed, dead man lifts the unconscious patrolman out of the Spike Growth and begins to stabilize him to make sure he does not bleed out. The remaining patrolmen try to trip Vimack, but he lowers his body and flexes, taking the sweeping attacks like a champ and stopping them. They try to trip Lorellai, and although she stumbles a bit, she catches herself and stands strong.
Evan takes to the air from the ground and gets over the wall as quickly as possible. He witnesses Vimack and Lorellai standing their ground against the monk patrols taking them on. Ronpip makes it into the sliding door and enters the estate. He quickly does his best to work through the estate to find Duan Ping. He knows that the nobles are likely to sleep upstairs, so heads to the second floor. Upon the hallway, he comes upon several doors with various animals carved into individual doors. He chooses to make his way to the room with the Tiger carved into it.
Critical Damage! Vimack takes a critical hit from a monk patrolman, striking in unison after Vimack dodges their kicks.
Ronpip quietly opens the door to peak inside to see who is inside. A flash and fast unsheathing of a sword strikes at Ronpip. But just barely misses Ronpip, inches from striking him across the face, its wielder Duan Ping. Ronpip can see the controlled malice on his face from being a trained warrior of the long sword, and he suddenly switches his expression as he realizes it is Ronpip at his doorway. Confused, he starts demanding Ronpip to explain why he is in the hallway, and Ronpip quickly tries to calm him down and to be quiet. He hands him the scroll they took from Xun Fen. Ronpip steps into the room so he is no longer in the hallway. Duan Ping reads the scroll, and expresses disgust. Ronpip also reveals that Qui Chun has a secret basement that stored Shadow Snapper products, as well as the Royal Healers noting the former Emperor was potentially poisoned. Duan Ping is heavily filled with disgust. He pulls a chime out of his robes and taps his scabbard. The patrol outside stops fighting suddenly.
Duan Ping is pleased the information as brought to him, and apologizes for the defensive welcoming. Ronpip shares his condolences, and says he should probably leave. Duan Ping tells him as last words to let his master (Evan) to meet him at the Pillars of Archons for an important message he needs to express to everyone. Ronpip acknowledges, and Dimension Doors outside the estate from the second floor, and lands upon the ground like the hero he is. Ronpip looks up and looks around for his friends or anyone, but is disappointed no one saw this feat.
Vimack and Lorellai help the monks back to their feet and help them. Vimack kindly thanks them for the bout, despite them not knowing who they were or why they were there. They bow in respect but say no words. Vimack bows back.
Evan reappears to Vimack and Lorellai. Vimack voices his odd feeling of disappointment; Evan confesses he misses the Feather Fall but Ronpip admits he was just surprised but otherwise is unbothered. Ronpip relays he gave the information to Duan Ping and wants to see him at the Pillars of Archons. Evan confesses he is tired and has throwing stars in his chest. Vimack pulls one out and keeps it. Ronpip takes the other one. The party returns to the estate, and Paul greets the party, and starts a bath for the party per request. The party rests, and in the morning, they go to meet Duan Ping at the Pillars of Archons in Session 15.
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 15
item.description:
Following Session 14:
The session starts with Duan Ping renouncing his own noble house, and removes himself from the candidacy for the throne of the emperor, and takes up the mantle of kings guard which disallows him to have children. Vimack Badger, Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Evan Escence, and Lorellai attend this announcement, and it is solemn energy across the public crowd. Evan tries to meet with Duan, and Ronpip hands him a short sword. Evan meets with Duan, and is reeled by the announcement. Duan explains that this was his intent the whole time, and though his mother is unhappy, she is in charge of the noble house but nothing more will damage their reputation. He wishes to bring back honor to his name, and seek justice against those who damaged the reputation of his house. They discuss who is left in the running, and Duan confides that they will work more together when Evan is emperor. Evan is taken aback, and hesitantly agrees.
He returns to the party, and together they agree to investigate the Cathedral of Stars. There, they discover that the Cathedral is a conglomerate of multiple gods together, revealing that Arcaedia allows for varying worship of many gods together. The Cathedral of Stars is very large, filled with people, and at the center is a massive armillary depicting the movement of the sun, the two moons, and stars or planes of existence in balance among themselves, spinning and orbiting in a complex series of movement. Vimack spots a Judge of Arcaedia and he asks him a hypothetical question about how to legally accuse a individual or group of higher social status. The Judge of Arcaedia relays hesitantly that he would probably want physical proof to identify those he wants to accuse, and states to take it up with the nobles, not with the Brotherhood of Judges or Sisterhood associated with them.
The party continues to look around, and Vimack is unable to see the high priestess of Cathedral of Stars or anyone else from the fight. Evan thinks back and remembers her name is Priestess Yurreina Paramoure. Lorellai uses her divine sense and immediately knows that she is a space that is protected by the Holy version of the Hallow spell, and detects a mix of more good than evil. Evan goes to the nearest priest of the Cathedral of Stars and asks where "sister" Yereina is, and he is corrected that she is "High" Priestess Yurreina Paramoure. The priest says she is not here, but her son Derek Paramoure is at the feeding house, feeding the beggars, and Atoli Paramoure is caring for the children and orphans of those visiting the temple. Vimack asks if there are more children of hers and the priest mentionsAlemhon Paramoure but that he is "rebellious". The party decides to speak to which ever they run into first. They run into Derek, who is in a kitchen dedicated towards feeding those who cannot feed or house themselves. He is not wearing the same Cathedral of Stars robes, but he has a well decorated scarf to make him stand out. Vimack approaches him and leads to Evan to ask the questions. Evan asks again for Priestess Yurreina Paramoure, but Derek says that she is not at the Cathedral of Stars, implying she has not actually worked here, especially for a length of time.
While the party is talking to Derek, an old lady comes up to Vimack, offering him a folded flower of parchment. She tells him to open it. Vimack opens the flower, and finds five gold coins, and a note written in it.
The note reads: "Tell your brother 'Thank You' for the advice. Here is his commission. And your reward for being a Liar. The Beak P.S. - You are always welcome to a Leatherback Tunn"
Vimack is stabbed by a poisoned dagger while he is momentarily distracted by the coins and note. No one has noticed this happen until Vimack suddenly reels in pain and sudden weakness that courses through his body. The last thing Vimack sees is the old hag who stabbed him smile with blackened teeth, and she seems to disappear into mist and shadow, but she is gone before the party could have seen her. Derek speaks out and asks if Vimack is okay in genuine concern, but Ronpip is now alarmed, and lashes out at Derek. Evan tries to defend Ronpip's sudden move change. Derek moves in to help, but Ronpip demands that Derek keeps his hands where Ronpip can see them. Vimack does his best to say that it was not Derek, but Ronpip is on edge. Lorellai uses her Lay on Hands to neutralize the poison within him, and heal him a bit. Ronpip sees that there are traces of black ichor on the healed portions of the wound. Vimack begins to rage, and the area becomes statically charged. Vimack is about to read the letter out loud, but Ronpip stops him. Ronpip apologizes to Derek for his outburst, and Vimack confesses that certain business has caught up to the party. Derek would like the party would leave due to the outburst.
The party leaves the facility, and Vimack hands the gold over to Ronpip as the letter implies such. Ronpip wishes to know where the nearest Leatherback Tunn is and Evan recalls the nearest one is definitely outside the temple district. The party questions if he really wants to resolve that now, but Ronpip reluctantly accepts they should seek out Atoli instead. The search for Atoli and come across a very roughly made daycare, and they spot a few women with headdresses, one with the same scarf as Derek. Evan tells Vimack if a kid offers him a flower, to not accept it and Ronpip agrees. Vimack is disappointed but concedes to the notion. Vimack steps over the fence and greets the kids, and they are completely enamored. Ronpip, meanwhile, is on watch, paranoid of any ne'er-do-wells potentially here to bother them again. Vimack proceeds to play with the children, allowing Evan to speak to Atoli though she remains busy with other children. Evan proceeds to ask about Priestess Yurreina Paramoure, but she says that they could find her at the estate, stating its odd that since she was blessed by a god that its odd she is never around. Evan inquires what god she is blessed by, but Atoli does not believe it matters. Evan is confused, as there are clerics and paladins about, but she reminds Evan that not all clerics are blessed, they simply do clerical work. Evan asks about Alemhon, but Atoli does not speak well of him in relation to the temple, saying he often runs off to do whatever he wants, stating if she had her mother's divining powers she might actually be able to find him. Lorellai relates with Atoli and has a conversation with her about her visions and abilities, and Atoli seems interested deeply, especially in the fact that she wears armor and has weapons. Atoli begins to call the children back and Vimack releases the kids from his entertainment, covered in child gunk. Evan uses Metaphycisian to peal away the gunk from Vimack and clean him of it.
The party leaves the temple district and proceed to take a detour towards the amphitheater, hoping things are left as is. And they discover nothing has been taken down quite yet, but the bodies of their oppressors are gone. Vimack lifts Ronpip and Evan and Lorellai to investigate the booths the nobles would have sat in to watch the fight between Escence and Urie. In Paramoure's booth, there appears to be a marking stained into the wood. Ronpip sees that it offers a very dim, faint aura of Conjuration. Lorellai recognizes it as demonic sigil of sorts. Evan channels psionic energy into his throat, and is able to read any language and speak to any creature in their language. Ronpip asks for paper, and Vimack hoists himself into the booth. Evan panics and tells him to be careful, and Ronpip is taken aback at how clear Evan's speech suddenly is. Vimack notices the sigil is stained into the plank of wood the floor is made from. Vimack pulls out his crowbar, and begins to rip out the plank. Lorellai is very concerned and wonders if this is a good idea, and Evan says its okay, he allows it, misunderstanding what Lorellai is actually concerned with. In response to Vimack, the booth begins to creek and waver, and begins to collapse now that a piece of the floor that was supporting it is being torn free from its nails. Evan gets piled on to into the collapsed booth while everyone else managed to roll out of the booth and to safety. They pull Evan out who cleans himself from the dust of the rubble. Evan wishes to go the estate of House Paramoure but Vimack proposes they speak to Duan Ping first, in order to gather further support.
The party returns the nobles district, and discusses just how much support they could acquire. Ronpip suggests talking to Chevelle, since they are one of the few Lorellai detected good from. They head to the Noble House of Foo first. The meet with Duan Ping in a familiar way, though more forward facing and less to the side with secrecy. They present the demon sigil on the wood plank to him and inquire if this is evidence to accuse Paramoure, but Duan Ping is not convinced this would be enough. Duan Ping also reveals he has no possible clue what Yereina's clerical domain would be as his culture does not dabble in religious magic, at least not to his knowledge. He offers a measured advice, and sends the party on the way with assurance that the party might need more to persuade the houses Evan has support with.
The party decides to return to Cathedral of Stars to poke around a little more. The temple is pretty full with sermon being spoken about a god of the harvest, with many merchants, farmers, and artisans listening and praying for a good season next year. Evan almost decides to leave and Ronpip protests wondering if Evan is concerned about his business having supply, but notices his father is there. He waves and calls out his father, and his father is caught by surprise, interrupting the sermon. Vimack meanwhile has been searching for a physician or medical ward. He finds a doctor and asks him about his stab wound. He gives it a look over and Vimack tries to face wave his party to ask the doctor things while he's here. They begin to ask him friendly questions, and then lean in to get answers for potentially why the Cathedral of Stars might need more shipments of medicines as of late. Ronpip glances around, and realizes that every patient has a Thrall's Neckpiece on their person. The group starts putting things together and realize there is potentially a cult involved in the distribution of the necklace. The party wishes to potentially talk with the patients, but the doctor has resignations. Lorellai states she is not afraid of one of them potentially shivs her. She takes a look at one of the Thrall's Neckpieces on a patient and immediately gets bad vibes from the item. Lorellai speaks to a patient who tells her he recieved the Thrall's Neckpiece from a friendly high elf, and that he and his family are sick. Ronpip has an educational discussion with the doctor, learning he attended the colleges across Arcaedia, and he has visited the other countries and kingdoms except Hvergelmir. He inquires about cadavers and the dead, and the doctor mentions there's a crematorium on the opposite side of the district, away from the Cathedral of Stars. Lorellai cures the mans wounds, and he feels a little better. Ronpip mentions there's a crematorium that the doctor mentioned, and the party heads to it. A graveyard surrounds the crematorium, and Ronpip notices that the crematorium was used as recently as last night. The party tries to determine what to do next, and an old man pulling a cart via a donkey is headed towards the crematorium. Ronpip greets him and he seems really keen on burning bodies. They have a discussion about how a lot of people die in the city and outside of the city, and Vimack is getting antsy with the dead bodies in the cart.
Vimack thinks they should break into the Paramoure estate, and gather as much information with subterfuge instead of asking around. Evan wants to scope out the outside before they break in. The party realizes Paul McCoy has been with them the whole time, remaining in the back and at a distance unless they needed to travel by canal waterway. They ask him for his advice, and he suggests the direct approach. Ronpip highly agrees, while everyone else starts agreeing as well that their attempts be sneaky and subtle have failed miserably.
They arrive at the estate of Paramoure, and it is open gates to a massive estate with multiple buildings within the property. There are no guards, and lots of religious iconography about, including a temple within the estate walls. Inside they find a strange, unidentifiable statue of what might be a goddess, with a diamond shaped hole in her chest. While in the temple, they see a mausoleum at the back of the estate. Ronpip is curious about the diamond shaped hole in the statues chest, and as soon as he gets high enough, sees only that it is carved through perfectly smoothed but otherwise unassuming. The party, no longer interested in sticking their hands into holes, head to the mausoleum. From what the party can see, this is where the house contains their ancestorial ashes. On the back of the wall, there appears to be an inscription in Celestial. Lorellai recognizes it, and says that it is Celestial writing stating: As above, so below; as within, so without. Ronpip uses his Detect Magic and see the inscription is magical and illusory in nature. Lorellai speaks the words in Celestial, and the floor drops and reveals a stairway that leads downwards. Celestial script glows with the same inscription, dimly lighting the way downward.
The party enter the catacombs with caution. Once they reach the bottom, the words stop providing light and instead a shimmering stone from the ceiling is dimly providing the light. The party continues deeper into the catacombs, and Vimack can visualize that it is following the same flagstone path leading to the temple is the same as the layout they are following. Eventually, the party reaches deep enough to hear some low chanting coming from ahead. Based on Vimack's understanding of the layout, they are in the under-temple, which appears to be a reversal of the temple above. And the statue from the temple on the surface is now on the ceiling, though now in an appearance of something more akin to a bandaged and dominated version, with a similar hole in the chest of a perfect diamond. The party has stumbled upon a sermon among cultist followers, with the leader in leather bandaged wear and blackened feathers aimed upwards for a more sharpened appearance. She speaks about war and turmoil, and helping the high elves win the invasion is the key to greater purpose. She wields an maul with complex arcane inscription written upon it. Evan confirms in a whisper that Priestess Yurreina Paramoure is most certainly guilty.
The chanting stops. The cultists rise and face the party. Ten of them are average robed humans, and three hulking members are standing before Priestess Yurreina Paramoure. She flourishes her maul, and proceeds to tell her cultists to attack the party.
Battle commences in Session 16.
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 16
item.description:
Following Session 15
The Priestess Yurreina Paramoure calls out to her cult followers and states that this is heir test for the upcoming war, to face down Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Vimack Badger, Lorellai, and Evan Escence in combat and win. The cultists remove their robes and reveal themselves to be in bondage attire, similar to Priestess Yurreina Paramoure. Ronpip clicks his boots together to activate the Boots of Speed, and he throws the Tool of War at the Priestess Yurreina Paramoure. The sword does not quite reach her, but does drop nearby. Ronpip teleports to his greatsword, moves to her. The large hulking cultists try to defend their priestess, but Ronpip dodges with his increased speed. Ronpip, goes in for a swing at the Priestess, and manages to strike her. Vimack immediately enters a Rage, Vimack rushes through the smaller cultists to the bigger brutes, taking attacks along the way but shrugging them off in his Rage but is held back from reaching the back end. Dorizoul follows along and Tramples a cultist along the way. Dorizoul then fires a barrage of magic missiles from her mouth at nearby cultists. Vimack attacks with both swords, but attempts to do so non-lethally, using the flat of his blades. Ronpip kicks his adrenaline in and immediately Thundersteps back to the party, blasting Yereina and her hulking cultists near her with a blast of concussive force. He notices that his strike causes a glamour on her bondage wear to shimmer, revealing armor beneath, as well as his concussive force seemingly dampened.
Critical Strike? Vimack attempts non-lethal damage by striking with the flat of his short sword blade, but ends up decapitating a smaller Cultist.
The cultists move in to surround the immediate threats. Four of them attack Vimack with serrated scimitars, only one of them manages to get into Vimack's flesh. Two of the hulking cultists begin a battle rage with blood curdling screams, and they strike at Vimack. Vimack manages to block away one attack but the other one comes in from behind and strikes at his back. Paul readies a defensive stance as three cultists attack him, and he deflects each scimitar swipe. The last hulking cultist momentarily decides who to attack, and hearing the pained scream of Vimack getting chopped into the back drives him towards Vimack. He takes a leaping slash:
Critical Wound! and critically wounds Vimack with his blessed great axe. The flash of the radiance blinding him for the rest of the encounter.
Lorellai rushes some cultists, bashing them with her flail and shield. Evan moves back slightly, and channels his psionic blast across the crowd of cultists. Several cultists go into seizures as their brains are overloaded with psychic energy and fall to the ground, no longer part of the combat. Vimack quickly disengages from being surrounded by the hulking cultists, and calls the Animated Shield from his back. Ronpip shifts the Tool of War into its Lance form and climbs upon Dorizoul. He goes in and rushes with Dorizoul to attack the hulking cultists with Booming Blade enhancing the strike, surrounding one in sonic energy, and skewering the other straight through. Paul goes in, proud of Evan for his crowd control, striking the hulking cultist near him with three powerful strikes as he can focus on his attacks and not defending Evan. Two punches and knees the cultist in the kidney before maneuvering himself between Evan and the remaining threats to continue to defend him.
Yereina speaks in Celestial and summons a spiritual weapon in the form of a Halberd, Lorellai tries to block it but only catches the haft and not the blade. Yereina begins to Toll the Dead and Evan attempts to Counterspell, but he notices that the maul shimmered in response to his spell. From the hallways of the catacombs, skeletons that Yereina spawned earlier have finally reached the combat. The last living cultist, seeing the folly of his actions, attempts to escape but the skeletons cut him down before he can leave. One of the hulking cultists maneuvers around Ronpip's threatening space and attacks Vimack. Vimack channels his Giant's lineage and his skin hardens for a brief moment and reduces the heft of the blow by quite a lot. The other hulking cultist rushes Paul, and Ronpip strikes him along the way, skewering him through the head. He makes final attack in his death throws and Paul is cleaved, knocking him out of the fight. The final hulking cultist rushes Ronpip and Dorizoul and swings for Ronpip, hitting him for quite a bit. Lorellai pulls Paul McCoy aside and heals him through the power of her blessing, reviving him back into the battle, albeit in a weakened state. Evan mixes the arcane weave with his psionic energy and casts Mystic Missile. Yereina overcomes the psychic influence, but the hulking cultists hit are affected. One is filled with despair and begins to lose all energy for the combat, but the other one becomes doubly enraged and he spins around with a wild swing to face Evan, nearly hitting Vimack but his shield comes to his rescue and blocks the attack. Vimack recklessly lashes at the angrier cultist, abandoning his defenses to get a strike in. Successfully hitting recklessly, he can feel his target through his short sword and goes in with his second. Vimack has gathered enough static energy within his body to then bolt him but his muscles are already so tense it seems like he shrugs it off. Dorizoul manages to gather enough energy in her throat, and fires off a barrage of magic missiles at enemies in sight. They notice that Yereina actively has a shield that is dampening the magic that strikes her.
Ronpip strikes into the enraged cultists side, and blood gushes from the wound but he stays standing. And then he pulls Dorizoul to rush Yereina with a Booming Blade Lance, but as soon as he hits her, the Booming Blade is immediately dispelled. Ronpip is now close enough to see that his magic is going directly into the Maul, and the Tool of War quivers in his hand with a feeling of concern coursing into Ronpip's dominant arm. Regardless, the lance goes in and he manages to stab a hole into Yereina with the lance form. Paul stands and once again puts himself in a defensive position to help protect Evan. Yereina moves forward to face off against Ronpip and Dorizoul, and Ronpip tries to get a stab in as she moves but she is too quick. She swings the Maul from below in an upwards strike.
Critical Wound Dorizoul is struck not only straight into the face with the head of the Maul, but the maul's magic seems to sear on a permanent Dispel Magic rune circle to her left eye.
Note This has caused an enchantment within her eye to be dispelled, allowing her to view translucent and refractive materials as a normal biological being would, instead of a blackened or physicalized void.
Dorizoul manages to stand her ground and not lose footing, but is clearly heavily damaged to the head. Ronpip maintains his place in the saddle as she stumbles a little. Immediate again, channeling her godly blessed energy, Yereina strikes a second time with her maul against Dorizoul and she is knocked back 15ft away from her. She's hurt, but stays to her feet, but is clearly weaning in strength. Yereina backs up and begins to cast a ritual, opening a blackened sliver that opens to a world of shadows. Lorellai begins to cast Dispel Magic to try and dispel the shield that seems to surround Yereina and dampening the magic. Nothing visual seems to happen. She then shield bashes the nearest skeleton but the skeleton seems to hang on and is unmoved.
Evan sees that she is opening a portal of sorts, and he sends My Immortal to grasp her, grappling her in place and preventing her from moving further. Evan then Misty Steps towards her and moves closer to Yereina in case she has other tricks up her sleeve. Vimack stabs into the enraged cultist with both blades into his vein bursting neck, blood gushes from his mouth and he finally lies still. Dorizoul quickly disengages at Vimack's command. Vimack channels Zephyr Strike and moves like the wind, and rushes to Yereina to strike but she wiggles just enough for him to miss, and his momentum ends up carrying him further away. Ronpip jumps off Dorizoul, morphs the Tool of War from a lance to a long sword, and also rushes Yereina. Even while grappled in My Immortal, she is able to get a reactive attack in, but misses as Ronpip blocks with his shield in hand, and he strikes her while she is held in place. Despite Lorellai trying to cast Dispel, it does not stop the shield that has surrounded her, and Ronpip loses the Booming Blade he put on the sword, as well as the Tool of War's normal enchantment as the blade strikes against her. With a second attack, Ronpip attempts to disarm her from the maul from her person, but she holds on with a vice like grip and does not allow it to leave her hand. Evan requests Paul to join in the attack, and despite, his fists do not seem to reach her, the glamoured armor stopping his attacks.
Danger A summoned skeleton comes to Evan and critically wounds him. Forcing him to roll concentration on his grasp, which he maintains despite the pain.
Yereina breaks free from My Immortal's grapple, and completes the portal's ritual. A the black tear into reality widens, warping the light into an inky black void. Shadowy mist pours from below and at the sides and it seems to struggle to maintain its opening. With her grapple free, Yereina falls into the darkness backwards with a taunting smile on her face. Evan hesitates on what options he has and tries to grab her back into catacombs from the portal; Ronpip accepts that she is gone and it is probably not worth chasing after her; Vimack rushes to dive in after her from behind Ronpip just before the portal seams itself closed.
The portal is closed. Without the priestess nearby, the skeletons fall apart and lay still in pieces. Ronpip hears the crying of the last hulking cultist, and approaches him. Evan moves to Dorizoul to help her, and sees that Vimack left a potion next to her. Evan notices on her eye a seared brand of arcane runes has scarred over, the same ones on the maul that Yereina was wielding, reading it as a Dispel Magic sigil. Ronpip lets the longsword become a great sword. Ronpip asks "One time only, where did she go..." but he is so filled with tears he does not initially notice. Ronpip smacks him with the flat of the blade and asks again. Startled, he replies he does not know. Ronpip threatens to cut off his legs but his reply remains the same. Disappointed, Ronpip believes him and tries to cut off his legs. But the Tool of War stops him and halts in place like an Immovable Rod, declaring that this is not a worthy strike. Ronpip, pissed and stressed from Vimack disappearing, demands to know what is wrong with him (the Tool of War) while glaring at the despaired cultist. The cultist is confused, and the sword refuses to budge. Evan, noticing Ronpip is having a hard time emotionally and mentally, relays that he has a method to find Vimack. Still upset, Ronpip is demands to know whats wrong with the cultist and Evan explains. Ronpip gives the cultist a smack on the ass, but the cultist seems to be uncomfortably(for everyone else) into it. Evan states he needs up to an hour to prepare a psychic ritual to find where Vimack has gone, so Ronpip continues to converse with the Tool of War. Paul restrains the crying cultist member to restrain him for later. Ronpip accuses his sword of not working or not fighting properly, but the Tool of War explains that the weapon she was carrying was disenchanting in nature, and could have permanently sealed him away in the blade and lost everything the blade has offered him. Dorizoul rises and limps to Ronpip for comfort while Vimack is gone. Ronpip asks how much power the Tool of War actually has, and its response is a resounding similar inquiry, as the Tool of War was never asked before, nor does it have any memory to recall a limit. The best it can come up with in a feeling of confusion, is that it is the source of power but Ronpip is the conduit to that power, just as it is the tool and Ronpip is the wielder, though the answer comes out in the form of a question, clearly showing even it does not understand how this exchange works. Ronpip accepts the answer but tells the Tool of War to continue to think on it. The Tool of War then offers Ronpip a ritual in which he can enter a communal space to speak directly to the entity within the Tool of War. Ronpip has concerns but ultimately accepts the ritual and performs it. Meanwhile, Lorellai heals Dorizoul and comforts her while everyone seems busy.
Ronpip uses his blood to draw an arcane circle, and he pulls out a playing card to light aflame. Ronpip puts the sword into the ground by the tip as instructed, and it seems to sink into the stonework, hilt up. Placing the burning card against the blade, Ronpip sits at the center of the blood drawn arcane circle, staring into his dark reflection until his vision begins to fuzz and waver, until goes into a trance.
