He finds himself in an iron cathedral, with a armored being chained and melted into slag that forms a throne seat over a blacksmith's furnace, long cold and without flame. Ronpip also finds a single chain tying him to the being. Tapestries of different weapons loom on the pillars that hold the roof above but lay still with no wind to move them. Ronpip asks "so are you in the sword?" and the being responds "I am the sword."
"How long have you been a sword?"
"Longer than I can remember; longer than this place has existed; longer than I have met you."
"Were you always that sword, or were you something different before?"
"I have been many things..."
Ronpip looks at the tapestries around him, and sees the evolved depictions of historical weaponry.
"How did you end up in there"
"I do not remember..."
"Why you chained?"
"I do not remember... I only know that I a tool for war; I am a weapon."
"So have you been held back this whole time?"
Ronpip gets silence, but also gets the feeling that the Tool of War does not know how to answer that question. Ronpip points out how frightening it would be if the Tool of War was being held back.
The same silence comes again, but its a silence in agreement.
"What is it that you wish of me...? If I am truly held back, and you are the conduit in which my source of power can grow... what is it that you wish from the Tool of War..."
Ronpip states he will need time to think about it, and wants to know how to kill the priestess. A faint ember leaves the helmet of the figure melted to the slag. And it responds that it confidently believes Ronpip will see her again, and the Tool of War will help him slay her, without fear or limitation. Ronpip thanks the being, and then asks how to leave.
Ronpip awakens. The Tool of War lifts itself out of the stone and falls, Ronpip catching it. THe blood circle wisping away as though it never happened.
Evan continues to to meditate and utilize My Immortal to find Vimack. Her scope continues to widen as she searches for him. And over the course of an hour, she relays to Evan:

Vimack is not on the Paramoure estate grounds.
Vimack is not within the noble's district.
Vimack is not in the Trading Capital, Vasaaros
Vimack is not in Arcaedia
Vimack is not on the Material Plane
Vimack is in the Plane of Existence known as the Shadowfell. Evan shares this with Ronpip. Ronpip has no inkling about what that entails, other than it has to likely be similar to The Feywild in some way. Ronpip wishes to know how to get there, Evan recalls his studying knowledge of how to get there, but notes he does not have the power by himself to get there. He thinks that his master Ed Sher'ran might know how to get there. Ronpip says he will stay to anchor the point of the crime scene, and sends Evan and Lorellai to find a Judge of Arcaedia, either to explain the situation and help them, or to directly help them. Evan quickly finds one nearby and explains himself and his situation to them as delicately as he can to not seem like he is just speaking slander. The Judge of Arcaedia wants immediately proof before checking things out and Lorellai states that she is a witness to the events and can relate as a paladin. The Judge of Arcaedia is reluctant and threatens Evan that if his time is wasted, there would be consequences. Evan takes him to the Paramoure estate, and the state of events is revealing. At first the Judge of Arcaedia is confused and on guard about the situation, but as he investigates, he sees that the events Evan spoke of were true to a point. He wants as much details of what happened, and Evan and Ronpip explain everything in as much detail as they can recall, including where Vimack and the priestess have ended up. Perturbed, the Judge of Arcaedia demands the group still in Paramoure to take a vow of silence about the actions he is about to perform, and threatens to send an Inquisitor of Arcaedia after them and "they will be silenced". They wholeheartedly agree to remain silent about what happens forthwith, and the Judge of Arcaedia begins to perform a ritual that is questionable for his morality and alignment, pulling out a gem of exquisite value in order to perform the magical ritual. Over the course of a minute, the same black tear begins to open.
Meanwhile, Vimack jumped through the portal and lands on the other side. Vimack sees a imitation of the same room he was in in the catacombs of the Paramoure estate, but everything is decrepit, destroyed, dry, cold, and grey. The ceiling is caved in, and the sky is a grey overcast that gives only a dim eerie light. He catches a glimpse of Priestess Yurreina Paramoure, and with her a male partner with scarlet eyes, gaunt features, dark hair, and barred fangs on the ground floor above. The male partner sees Vimack, kisses the Priestess Yurreina Paramoure, and disappear in a swarm of bats into the distance. Then, there is nothing but silence and a breeze that smells of old death. Vimack explores a little but does not go far, slowly making his way out of the catacombs, exiting and sees the shadowed ruins of the city. He returns to the alter, and begins to sit and wait in a defensible position in this dark and alien space. Vimack then catches glimpses of shadows moving about him. He sees grery, pale humanoids come out from the corners of shadows; stoic and emotionless elves in black leathers. They keep their distance but stare at Vimack. They are unmoving and do not seem like a threat. From behind, Vimack hears a soft, eerie female voice, who greets him by his race. He turns to look, and sees a strange being with a raven mask and covered in a cloak of raven feathers. She tells him he is in the Shadowfell, and that it is strange for him to be here.
Vimack explains that he was following someone, and she first questions but then makes a statement like she knows who he was chasing after. She tells him that his people call her The Raven Queen. Vimack is trying to understand her intent, but her body language is very foreign to him. She creepily circles him slowly, a metallic clinking chiming with every methodically slow step. She states the question that he is following "The Bat", and the woman who is emulating her guise. Vimack hesitantly agrees but is unsure that is exactly correct. The Raven Queen states she wants a favor from him, continuing to circle him slowly. She wants him to kill "The Bat" for her, as she feels he is invading into her realm and eludes her every time he comes within the realm. Vimack continues to process her expression, her words, and her intent, but he cannot get any read on her.
Vimack asks what "The Bat" looks like, and she tells him he's already seen him, and proceeds to provide a long, creepy description of him. Vimack asks what he will receiving for completing the task, and she only replies that it is a reward, of sorts. She offers him a way to return to his friends, and sees that he thinks fondly of his friends. Vimack is creeped out by how much she seems to enjoy the notion in her low voice.
Vimack asks how to find him, and she says that they will meet in due time, from what she has heard. She simply wants him to make sure he stays dead. Vimack, once again, asks about the reward, and she coyly states that he will know when he completes the task, goading him to respond if he can keep that promise. She seems to be enjoying the taste of Vimack's panic and anxiety. She speaks about his companions; his brother, the noble, his pet.
Vimack nervously asks how she knows, and she explains coyly that she can see it all in his memories, and she enjoys the stories of other's memories, as she caresses the back of his head with taloned nails.
Vimack asks how he makes sure he stays dead. The Raven Queen explains that, when he comes from the North, and they kill him, that he will flee back North. And if they can follow him back, to kill him a second time, and to make sure he stays dead. Again, she goads him to commit to the inquiry.
Vimack asks for a name. She gives him Elwin Petyra. She once again goads an answer from him, and Vimack points out he's not in a position in which he can say "no". She is pleased with his answer. She asks if he is ready to return home, or if he has more questions. Vimack wants to make sure she does not intend to kill him, and she is (dramatically and coyly) taken aback, as he had just made a promise to kill her enemy and the notion would be silly. She continues to socially toy with him while he nervously prays to himself that his friends are coming to save him.
Vimack asks about his dragon's origin, but she does not know anything about it.
Vimack asks about his own home. And she tells him "That is a good question" before pushing him. He has a suddenly feels a hand grab him by the shoulder, and pull him out through a blacked tear in reality, causing him to fall to his back along the steps of the pedestal.
Immediately, a Judge of Arcaedia with a helmet removed begins to demand Vimack to prove he is still sane of mind. Vimack looks around slightly disorientated and sees Ronpip and Dorizoul. He tries to get up to get to them, but the Judge of Arcaedia holds him down and pulls his face close, demanding he speak aloud to him to know that he is not possessed by something malicious and foul. He asks his name, and Vimack answers. He asks him to relay where he is currently, and Vimack answers to the best of his ability. The Judge of Arcaedia, satisfied Vimack is himself, releases him. Vimack immediately rushes to Dorizoul and the two nuzzle each other. The Judge of Arcaedia closes the portal as quickly as possible. Vimack investigates Dorizoul's eye, and Evan explains its purpose. He realizes that it took a Judge of Arcaedia to pull him out from the Shadowfell, and Vimack thanks him, with the rest of the party following. The Judge of Arcaedia treats it casually, and says he will send a "crew" to deal with the bodies and hidden temple the party has unveiled to him. Evan inquires how the Noble House of Paramoure will be judged for these transgressions, and he says that they will likely send an Inquisitor of Arcaedia after them and "inquire" everyone's standing in the house. He then tells them to gather the noble houses and do the thing that nobles do. Evan asks for the judge's name, but he reminds Evan that they are not to speak of this, and thus no names. He gives the party an alibi to state should anyone ask; that they had kindly led the judge to a cultist inhabitance that happened to be in a noble estate, and that they are merely informants. He then declares to Vimack to not speak of what had happened in the catacombs. Vimack asks if he needs to know what he saw, but the Judge of Arcaedia simply tells him "no". To "Keep it quiet; keep it safe. Whatever happened, leave it." Vimack nods. The Judge of Arcaedia takes the tied up crying cultist and leaves.
Evan thinks its best to return to the house and rest. Paul McCoy offers everyone a bath once again. Evan shares concern, but Paul shrugs it off, stating his father has done worse. Together, the three bath again, and Dorizoul is with them, and seems intrigued by the bath water. Vimack takes notice and swishes his hand in the water, and notices the branded eye is watching his hand. He beckons her closer, and she comes forward, and he does his best to introduce the concept of water to her. But her trust in Vimack lets her accept that Vimack is able to put her in the water. Everyone is proud of her. Vimack also quietly explains what he encountered and witnessed in the Shadowfell. Evan does not recognize the name Elwin Petyra, and in the thoughts of noble men, he comes to realize he is the last in the running. Ronpip wants clarification about how to kill him, but Vimack re-explains the instructions of how many times to kill him but not the method to keep him dead. Ronpip lets the gears come together, and he concludes Vampire.
The next day dawns, and the meeting of nobles commences. Evan takes notice that no one from the Noble House of Paramoure is attending the meeting, or representing them. Tylos Laetios Mositia is taken aback, as each noble house begins to nominate and declare fealty to the Noble House of Escence and Evan Escence's claim to the throne as Emperor to the Arcaedian Dominion, and not a week ago they were bickering for months. Vimack gives Evan a slap on the back in congratulations.
The coronation happens quickly because the absence of a high leader has left a void for a very long time. Evan's parents attend the coronation; his mother is stunned, his father is leaping for joy, and his sister is clearly jealous and holding it in. Evan tells Duan that Arcaedia needs to prepare for the invasion from the North. Evan asks about the former royal advisor, and Duan states that he is on house arrest per his (own) orders. He offers to be Evan's advisor instead. Vimack and Ronpip hype Duan up to be his advisor. Evan accepts. The realization that he is emperor makes him reminisce about their adventures together, and he begins to hand off some of the items he has on his person to the others. He gives Vimack The Talisman of Pure Good, reminding him he is a noble and honorable warrior. He gives Ronpip the Wand of Fireballs, and tells him to cause chaos. He gives Lorellai the Gauntlets of Flaming Fury, and tells her that, even though she is made of water to keep the flame alive in her heart. He mentions that the one thing he will truly miss about their adventures, is being able to gather again when its over and take a bath together. They give each other one last great group hug, and wave off Evan as Duan takes him to speak about the defense of Arcaedia with the other noble houses.
Momentarily without direction, Lorellai excitedly reminds Ronpip and Vimack about her dream mission. The two agree, and they make preparations before heading North to Phocellis, where Evan's brother also happens to be on a business trip for. Vimack calculates the distance, and it will take them a couple of days travel. They exit through the Northwestern gate, where the highway will take them directly to the town they intend to visit. Suddenly, the party hears the sound of thunder just outside the gates, but there are no clouds in the sky. They pass the gate, and they hear it again as a clay disk lands in front of their horses. Ronpip and Vimack get immediately defensive. Ronpip tries to kick the clay disk away, and a Tabaxi comes rushing to them and apologizing and telling them to leave the disk alone. The Tabaxi promises that the clay disk is harmless but that does not stop Vimack from hopping off his house and flourishing his short swords, Ronpip from yelling at him and threatening him, Lorellai from donning her flail and shield and activating the Gauntlets of Flaming Fury, and Dorizoul from charging arcane energy into her mouth in preparation for a barrage.
The Tabaxi flicks two fingers out and a card appears between the two fingers. He introduces himself as Antilean Faraday of the Faraday Firearms Incorporated. He apologizes for his associate for accidentally firing the disk in their direction. Antilean whistles and a clockwork quadrupedal object comes to him. He puts the disk to into a contraption, and Ronpip wants to know what it is! Antilean calls it Dragoon, which Ronpip notices that it has Gnome influence in its design and engineering. Antilean offers to demonstrate what Dragoon and he can do. A noble impatiently is waiting for Antilean to demonstrate what his proposal was. Antilean has Dragoon fire the disk into the air, and Antilean whips out a handcannon, firing it and shoots the disk out of the air. Antilean flourishes his "Faraday Firearm - Big Iron" and explains its capabilities, and then presents the price to the noble. The noble is appalled at the price and tells him to take his business to someone who is not scamming them out of their entire gold vault.
Vimack points out that he's not a good sales man, and Antilean admits that its true. He's only ever sold one other gun but Vimack and Ronpip interrupt him before he explains where the first gun went. Ronpip and Vimack discuss their plans with Evan, and a gateguard comes forward to tell Antilean he is disturbing the peace and needs to leave. Antilean apologizes and begins to pack his wagon. Lorellai wants to know if he can join them, but Ronpip and Vimack are reluctant and highly suspect. Antilean sees this as an opportunity in joining the party. Ronpip asks Lorellai to cast Zone of Truth, and then begins to ask Antilean suspect questions to check if he is potentially working with the enemy. Antilean has never been in the field before, and finds that he is compelled to speak the truth to these questions. They ask him if he knows who he is, and he's heard some impressive rumors that seems to fit the three of them, as well as someone has published a book that describe Ronpip, Vimack, and the Arcane Wyvern and a noble who went on an adventure to a swamp and defeated an Elven Lich. Vimack connects the dots, and realizes it was Kashoon who wrote that book. Ronpip wants to verify that Antilean does not know what the party is intending to do. Antilean says he does not know anything about anything about the party and begins an exposition about his own history. Vimack and Ronpip hop on their hoses while Antilean converses with himself, only to see its time to leave. He hops on his wagon, and follows the party.
While they get farther along the highway, Antilean inquires where the party is heading. They tell him Phocellis and he recalls his last time he was in Phocellis. Ronpip looks about Antilean wagon, that seems to be a hodge-podge of panels and doors. Antilean inquires about the names of his new traveling companions. Vimack introduces himself as Vimack Badger of House Escence, and Ronpip is thrown off. Ronpip introduces himself as Ronpip Thimble-bimble shimble dimble rimble pimble, bodyguard of House Escence. Lorellai introduces herself as Lorellai. And Vimack shows off Dorizoul which Antilean finds cute. Antilean reintroduces himself, his horse, and Dragoon. Vimack says his trademark "Good morning" even though Antilean clearly sees its the afternoon.
And the party continues their travels into Session 17
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 17
item.description:
Following Session 16
Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Lorellai, and Vimack Badger, now joined by Antilean Faraday, have left Vasaaros for Phocellis to follow up on Lorellai's dream quest.
Along the way, Antilean notices that Ropip has had some methodical exercises throughout the trip, practicing his disciplinary techniques passed down from being a veteran soldier. Antilean waves down Ronpip, and asks him if he would like to try out his Big Iron, the handcannon he used a few days back to demonstrate to a noble. Ronpip is a mix of intrigue and hesitancy, which Ronpip can feel its heft and personally see its design. Antilean begins to explain how it works and how to use, and sets up a target for him to try out with live fire. Antilean calls over Vimack to take a look at both he weapon's demonstration and Ronpip's potential skill with it. Vimack proceeds to them, though is nervous and suspect of Antilean. Ronpip aims the Big Iron, and first shot makes a bull's eye on the target. Vimack, in reaction to the sound and strike against the target, goes into a rage, channeling lightning through his body as he questions what just played out in innocent misunderstanding. He asks Ronpip what is the object and its "devil magic" and Ronpip points out its pretty normal physics and alchemy, and demonstrates by firing an Eldritch Blast, that such a feat is closer to what Vimack is describing, as the Tool of War comes into his hand and emulates the shape of Big Iron, though clearly is just a hunk of metal with no moving parts. Vimack, enraged that these explanations are not fitting together in his head, builds enough electricity to then strike the target with the latent lightning building in his body. Then, Ronpip takes a moment to notice that the Tool of War is in the form of a hand cannon and questions it, and it replies that this form is the same as the "weapon" in his other hand. Antilean takes interest in Ronpip's Tool of War but Ronpip shows him the Tool of War in the hand cannon form, and questions how the device functions. Vimack really wants to see Ronpip hand the Tool of War over to Antilean, knowing it has immense weight when not in Ronpip's hands. Ronpip is hesitant and asks the Tool of War for consent as well as warning Antilean that he does not know what he is in for. However, Antilean is too intrigued by the device to consider what that means. Ronpip hands over the Tool of War, and immediately, Antilean's hands drop from the weight and Antilean panics from the weight, demanding Ronpip take it before he drops it. Ronpip easily lifts it out of his hands like it weighs a little more than nothing, while Vimack and Dorizoul roll about the ground giggling at the show. Lorellai also wants to try an finds she can't hold the item either. Antilean shares an idiom that he finds best describes the situation.
On another day of camping, Antilean manages to explain his craft to Vimack; and Vimack, having a history of blacksmithing, is much more interested in Antilean and his artisanship. Vimack recalls a shield he smithed, a kite shield he had to forge a phoenix insignia designed within that he was commissioned from within Thimbleville as a memorial present to someone who had passed. The group of them show off each other's tools of their trades. Antilean unlocks and unfolds his wagon, showing off his accoutrements that fold into the limited work space. Vimack dumps out his Thimbleville made smithing tools, which Antilean recognizes their origin for their unique design. Ronpip also has a set of Tinkerer's Tools, on the off chance he decides to tinker with something. Through this, they find a better point of commonality and comradery.
While traveling, Antilean calls the group over and wishes to tell them a tale within his life. He talks about when he was still with his caravan, he and a few brothers and sisters needed to trap some dangerous creatures. They managed to track the creatures down, and split up to converge on the creatures with tactile strategy, but the creatures found Antilean's partner, and Antilean had to stand his ground against the creatures until help could arrive. And that's how he met Serran. Vimack is confused, and Antilean explains further, including kids he had with Serran.
Just as the tale of Antilean's life comes to a close, Vimack and Antilean notice that down the road, there are two conspicuous bushes on either side of the travel road, and a humanoid has another over his shoulder, appearing to try and help him cross the road. Vimack glances at the bushes some more, but sees nothing; Antilean recognizes this ploy from his own travels. Vimack speaks up and points out someone is hurt, but Antilean tries to stop him, knowing that something is very likely going on. Vimack rides ahead to call out to the injured folk ahead, asking if they need assistance. Ronpip and Antilean prepare a level of defenses between them, and Ronpip keeps up behind Vimack. Lorellai joins up with Antilean. Vimack dismounts, and moves forward to help them out.
As Vimack is approaching, the two playing injured and helper stand up straight and pull out heavy crossbows, aiming at him and the party. Four more men from each bush hope out, with heavy crossbows as well. And four more lift up a false carpet of grass from the sides of the road, and aim their crossbows at the party from behind them. Surrounded, a mustard yellow Tiefling with pitch black horns struts out from one of the bushes into the road to lead his merry highway men, who are all wearing green and grey leather armor, showing their coordination and unison. The Tiefling attempts to instruct the group on what to do in their situation, but Vimack is much more concerned about the potentially injured man from earlier. He argues between Vimack and Ronpip on what the party should do versus what it is the party is doing, leading to chaotic banter between the two groups.
Vimack is unsure what to do, asking his brother, Ronpip, what to do in this situation, but their brotherly banter leads to mixed instructions. Antilean is also confused and vexed by the current events, unsure if he should continue to keep a hand on Big Iron or what an alternative might look like. Vimack looks around him, and at first believes that he is outmatched from numbers alone; but after bantering between the tiefling, his brother, and himself, he notices that these men are definitely not actually prepared for the party, such as people's aim being slightly off, the smugness of their leader, and on a deeper level the flaws of the strategy these highwaymen are using begin to show more and more. Ronpip has had enough time to assess them, and he determines he could probably flick them and they would keel over. Antilean keeps making threats, and Ronpip tries to keep him calm and to wait things out for now. The Tiefling clarifies that all they want are their goods in the wagon and anything they have on hand, a simple request in his words. Ronpip asks how much they will pay for their stuff, and the Tiefling says they will recieve the party's things for free.
Antilean, being a coin-minded marketer, ain't having that, and shoots a guy. Vimack goes into a rage and tries to trip the tiefling leader, but he manages to jump over the flat of the blade. Ronpip summons the Tool of War as a lance in preparation for a fight, and fires an Eldritch Blast through it, striking the rapier in the tiefling's hand and obliteration the rapier, its guard, and the sword hand of the tiefling. The tiefling has to take a moment to understand what had just happened, and begins to scream in pain and caress his hand. His comrades begin to panic, unsure what to do, and Antilean continues to threaten them. They throw their weapons down and apologize, surrendering to the party.
Ronpip tells everyone to calm down, rides over to the tiefling leader, and begins to measure his nub to put on a hook. The tiefling begins to pass out in shock, and Ronpip has to tourniquet his arm before he bleeds out. Antilean and Vimack begin to lecture the group on their actions and to reconsider heir lives and futures. Antilean and Vimack work together to melt down the pieces of the exploded rapier to form a hook, and Ronpip takes the parts and tinkers it together into a functional hooked prosthetic. They then tell them, once again, to make due with better lives. They even present them ideas of guarding caravans or joining a fighter's guild or joining the army.
Then one of them mentions they have a tower. Suddenly there is more interest from the party. Their leader, who says that his name is Belton Ferroph, says he does not want to give up the tower, but is conflicted with most recent events that transpired. Vimack reiterates that he will not be seeking criminal activity, and intimidates the tiefling into taking up painting, which he reluctantly agrees with. A bald headed highwaymen, who introduces himself as Gauffery, takes them off the path to the tower they used as their hide out. The tower sits just at the edge within a nearby forest, reaching just above the treeline which allowed it to be hidden behind the trees. Oddly, there does not appear to be door, but there is are a block with folded hands surrounded by eight tiles, and a keyhole between them at what could be regarded as the "front" of the tower. The tower itself looks like its made out of stone carved bricks, but Ronpip gives it an inspection and sees that it is actually a well disguised clay. Gauffery does a quick tap combination, and the folded hands on the block unfurl and pull the bottom of the tower open like drapes, opening it to the party.
Inside, they see sets of cloths and bedrolls. Vimack climbs a ladder in the center of the room to reach the second floor with Antilean following behind, where it seems like the leader stays, as well as storage for the objects they stole from various targets. Ronpip and Lorellai stays with Gauffery on the ground floor. Antilean immediately goes for the trove of stolen objects, and its apparent that based on the varying mundane objects, they stole from fairly easy targets. Together with VImack, they find:

Abacus
Block and Tackle
Block of incense
Two ten foot chains
box of chalk (10)
climber's kit
fish & tackle
manacles
steel mirror
Painter's Supplies
Ordinary Pot with Dirt
Odd Goggles
Vimack immediately sets up the Painter's Supplies, but Antilean lets him know he sent the guys off to the city for betterment, but that does not stop Vimack. He does his best to nicely arrange the paints to be welcoming to the leader. Antilean examines the goggles, and sees that they are magically enchanted with the ability to read objects. He looks through the lenses, and it seems to label objects. He puts them on and starts to see that it begins to label various objects around him. With the goggles on, he sees that the ordinary pot with dirt is labeled with question marks and offers a green outline.
Vimack climbs higher, and reaches an open air rooftop of the tower. At the center is a pedestal that appears to be a frame shape. Vimack does some heavy thinking, and remembers Yohan put his town's deed into a similar frame. Vimack calls out to Ronpip to join him with the deed to a tower they found in the sewers of Massarnae. Ronpip comes up and pulls out the deed. And splays it out into the frame, and it begins to magically fold into a paper key. Ronpip pockets the key and Vimack remembers that a keyhole was present with the folded hands outside. Antilean scoops a majority of the trove into Vimack's Bag of Holding, and they all proceed back to the ground floor. They all head outside, and Ronpip puts the key into the keyhold left in the block of folded hands. He turns the key, and the tower begins to fold in on itself from the top to the bottom, and coalesces into a single block of folded hands. The Painter's Supplies are completely destroyed, scattered across the ground as they were expelled from the folding tower. Vimack is very sad.
Ronpip picks up the single block, where the paper key has pealed away into clay, and puts it into his adventuring pack. He asks what Gauffery is going to do now, but all he gets is a blank stare. Vimack wants to have him tag along, but Ronpip is concerned he would be more problematic than worth taking. Antilean thinks it might be best to drop him off at the town they are stopping at. Ronpip asks what he's good at, and considers if he can take directions well, and Gauffery says that he takes directions very well, and thats how he got his job as a highwayman. Ronpip tells Gauffery to follow them to Phocellis and they will find him something else to do.
After some days, they find that they have ran out of rations and must hunt to have food for the continue travels. Ronpip and Vimack go out to hunt while Antilean, Gauffery, and Lorellai stay put to set up camp. They manage to get two day of rations before they need to hunt. Gauffery offers to make a stew out of the hunted finds, pulling out cooking supplies. He makes a fairly good food prep, and Ronpip offers that he should do this for a living, though Gauffery is hesitant.
As the two days pass, Vimack wants to seek Elk or Deer but he struggles on the first day. Ronpip is also foraging as they travel, and unfortunately gathers berries that are not for consumption, and consumes them along the way. While Ronpip has to stop to drop his pants, Vimack goes back out into the nearby forest, and attempts to find some local critters. He casts Speak With Animals and attempts to gather information from them. He stays low and stealthy to not startle either a fox or rabbit, who's tracks he is tracking. He spots the rabbit, and stays low and non-aggressive and distant, trying to make sure he does not scare it away. The rabbit wide eyed regards Vimack nervously. Vimack inquires about a deer, or elk. Or wolves. The rabbit nervously reacts to the word "wolves", but says there are none here. The rabbit says he knows where deer are, and points it out, but is unwilling to go himself. He points out a doe and her faun, but Vimack is hesitant. Vimack asks about other deer, not wanting to kill a mother or her child. The rabbit points out a different direction, two brothers fighting. Vimack heads in the direction the rabbit pointed out, and he finds two deer with antlers locked, insulting each other as his spell to Speak With Animals is still active. The two are insulting each other, calling each other names, and overall being a nuisance, at least to Vimack's ears. Vimack takes two shots and downs one, to the dismay of the other brother; who has not taken notice to Vimack but is hormonally bothered by his brother's deadweight on his head suddenly, vocally continuing to insult him. Vimack is very sad about this predicament, and Vimack provides mercy shots to end the last brother. Ronpip has cleared his bowels, and recollects those berries for potential use elsewhere(not eating). They camp for the night, consuming venison cooked by Gauffery.
They make it to Phocellis. Antilean recalls that his caravans have been more accepted in Phocellis compared to every other Arcaedian city or town. The city is just south of a large lake, which Lorellai has pointed out in her dream journey as the place to go for one of the Facets of Virtue, or at least that's what she believes and is otherwise not completely clear. Ronpip wants to drop him off at the Blackwood Company, though Vimack is unsure. Ronpip remembers that Phocellis has a history of magical experimentation that suddenly stopped, but verbally reassures Vimack that this place is totally fine. They take Gauffery to a Blackwood Company, and deliver him as a cook to a rather bored tenant of the facility. They try to ask him about any work nearby, but the bored tenant says that nothing really happens here, though, really he means that everyone is saying everything is always happening, but its never anything, really. He does point out theres been a very bothersome noble running around bothering folks, describes him as wearing Lavender and White Robes. The party parts ways with Gauffery and begin to investigate where the noble is in town, forgetting to ask the bored tenant of Blackwood Company.
While investigating for what they presume is Evan's brother, questioning the locals has led to each of them providing various conflicting rumours about the lake and wilds nearby. They do manage to narrow down where he is, and find Leeland Essence trying to request from the locals something that is important to him. As the party approaches, they find he is continuously demanding for a boat or at least a ride across the lake, but the local he is requesting from is adamant not to do so. They greet him with his brother's name, to Leeland's surprise, and then mention they are not only his friends but that Evan is also emperor of Arcaedia now, to Leeland's dismay. They take him to a pub to calm him down and get more information from him, finding out that the "business trip" has been a fetch quest that has been more or less unfulfillable. He has been sent to find a special herb that's located on an island in the lake, but no one seems willing to take him across the lake. Except one, which Leeland is clearly bothered by and does not wish to engage with. The party tries to understand why this particular person is not to be spoken to, but Leeland does not want to speak his name in superstitious fear that it might actually attract the person. Antilean offers to give him a ear so he can speak it quietly and he can relay it with special magical words. Leeland sighs and, as quietly as he can, shares the name of the only person with a boat willing to take him across the lake.
 Magnanimous Montgomery Mortertimer Mount Mobius Morgan But You Can Just Call Me Cahoots
Leeland explains that this is his entire name, and the man refuses to listen to anything other than the full name. Ronpip asks what he does, and Leeland replies that he is a fisherman. He is the only fisherman because no one wants to go on the lake. Vimack wonders if there is anyone else that would let them take a boat, and Leeland, exasperated, explains that he's tried everything he could. He's asked politely, he's offered money, he's offered services(tame and otherwise), and nothing has convinced any local to let him borrow a boat. Ronpip offers to go in Leeland's stead, but the entire party relays that they do not really know how to handle plants. Leeland points out that his mother provided him with a special fitting that will contain the plants and keep them fresh after picking for travel. Vimack offers to try and convince a local himself, and takes the party to the local docks of Phocellis, where he discovers there is but one boat on the docks. A painfully obvious boat. Vimack begins to question how these people live on a lake with boats and there is one fisherman in town, but realizes about putting the two and two together that Leeland is making assumptions about a lake with a dock and people must have boats given the geographical feature.
The party approaches and see a tiny, crazy gentleman working the nets, whom they can presume to be Magnanimous Montgomery Mortertimer Mount Mobius Morgan But You Can Just Call Me Cahoots. Ronpip tells Leeland to reluctantly explain what he needs, and Leeland begrudgingly explains he needs to venture across the lake to an island. The party begins to introduce themselves, to the enjoyment of Magnanimous. Ronpip asks him if anyone else in town has a boat, which Magnanimous obliges to, mentioning he has a brother who has a boat. Ronpip would like to meet him, so Magnanimous goes to an alleyway, puts on a hat, and adds Junior to his name with a loud and extended inflection. Leeland is beside himself with clear annoyance, and complains to the party that this is exactly why he did not want to speak with this psychotic person. The party tries to have a conversation with him and convince him to help them to an island on the lake, and it goes about as well as it would seem, with Magnanimous changing the subject often, or speaking in conflicting information and making implications. He asks what the party would trade for his boat service, and Ronpip offers him a bottle of Thimbleville Mead, which he quickly downs. Appreciating the drink, he tells the boys to get on his boat, and they begin to sail off into the mists of the lake and into the unknown.
Into Session 18 ...
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 18
item.description:
Beginning after Session 17, we get a recalled memory of Ronpip, who snuck off from the party to complete some untouched business that has been bothering him since his brother was stabbed in the soup kitchen. He finds himself on a busy street, in front of a Leatherback Tunn. Ronpip enters, and the host greets Ronpip by name. Ronpip is momentarily surprised, but the host clarifies that he is always welcome to a Leatherback Tunn, per "his" orders. Ronpip requests to speak with The Beak. The host hesitates, but seems like he is compelled to take Ronpip to a secreted room behind the bar. Ronpip is taken to a Greeting Room, where Ronpip is taken to a table with two seats. Ronpip waits exactly four minutes, before The Beak appears from the shadows and sits at the table with Ronpip, with two pints of mead in his hands. Ronpip takes notice that there is a gash across his left eye, which he did not see before. Ronpip and him have a discussion about recent events, Ronpip pointing out that The Beak clearly does not want wanton murder. He offers The Beak that he will promise to stay out of The Beak's business ventures, and The Beak states that Ronpip may occasionally get a letter if they are getting too close to breaking this promise. Ronpip agrees to the terms, and walks out of the Leatherback Tunn, unimpeded or bothered. He picks up some wax paper and ink, and returns to his party.
The party begins their sail through Lake Ozsmark sailing on Magnanimous Montgomery Mortertimer Mount Mobius Morgan But You Can Just Call Me Cahoots's boat, named after himself, but a boat. Magnanimous is pushing the boat along the lake with a long oar. Vimack offers to push the boat, and he gives it a good boost through the waters, catching Leeland off balance with the sudden jerk of speed. A fog wall encroaches in front of them and is making it hard navigate further, not to be helped by Leeland's lack of direction to the island he is looking for. Vimack stops the boat just before they reach the fog wall, and Ronpip sees through the Tool of War that the fog wall is, in fact, magical in nature. Despite, they pass into the fog wall, the smell of ozone filling their noses and Vimack noticing his sense of North is significantly weakened. With no immediate direction, Magnanimous barefoot and barehanded climbs his mast in order to see if he can see anything above the fog. He spots an island and points it out. Vimack pushes the boat towards the direction Magnanimous points out, and Antilean climbs the mast to confirm Magnanimous' view, and tilts the boat dangerously as Vimack tries to turn it. Antilean cannot see anything, and he returns back down. As Vimack continues to be guided by Magnanimous, the mist opens, and a small pocket of open air surrounds an small, half-mile wide island with trees on it. Vimack notices birds in the trees but they are not making noise. Ronpip casts Detect Magic, and manages to concentrate through the myriad of colors to see that it gives off a large aura of illusion. Vimack wants to see what the island is about but Ronpip is worried it might be a crab. Vimack and Antilean lob things at the island, but no sound seems to be coming. Vimack tries to peer through the trees when Leeland asks if there are flowers, but Vimack cannot see any. They beach the island, no sound of the water dispersing, and cannot hear each other speaking. Vimack shoves his head into the water out curiosity, and discovers it did not change the sound. The party does their best to communicate non-verbally, as all words spoken seem to be extremely muffled. They determine how well they can communicate, and explore inwards to the center of the island. As they approach the center clearing, they do not spot these blue flowers Leeland is searching for and Ronpip does not witness anything odd or strange about the environment, other than the field of illusory magic that seems to mute all sounds. The party returns to the boat, and realize they are unaffected once they get off the beach.
Vimack pushes the boat East-ish, back into the fog, and soon discover another island that initially appears exactly as the one before. Antilean and Vimack spot that there are animals on the island, and they seem to be shunting and appearing back a short distance. Vimack beaches the boats. The party checks if they can hear each other, and it seems this island does not have the same deafening silence radiating from it. Leeland notices the animals teleporting about, and wishes he could have a stew from those animals. Vimack is disappointed, since this sounds so closely like Evan. Vimack steps off the boat, and the moment he touches the sand, he is teleported 20ft on to the island. While Vimack is discovering how the antics of the island teleportation works, Antilean asks Leeland about the Blue Flowers and what they are for. Leeland relays that they are for a special perfume his mother intends to make, but offers no details. Antilean is suspicious but does not press further. Vimack, 20ft into the island, tries to see if there are blue flowers on the island, and Dorizoul follows Vimack on to the island, teleporting to his feet. Vimakc tells her to sit, and calls out to Ronpip for rope, which he then ties to himself while Ronpip ties the other end to the boat. Vimack carefully picks up Dorizoul and proceeds further into the island. The sudden blips of movement that Vimack is making is disorienting, and Vimack ends up rope lining himself from the amount of movement, and Dorizoul is tossed from his hands. Vimack is distraught, knowing if he moves or she moves, they will end up teleporting a distance instead of being able to move directly to each other. Ronpip, concerned about his brother since the rope was tot for a moment, he leaves the boat and ends up teleporting 10ft on to the island. Antilean is concerned about Vimack and Ronpip now, and hesitates about entering the island. Ronpip tests the jaunting, and follows the rope as best as he can while navigating the island and the movement teleportation. Vimack can see Ronpip teleporting around nearby, but is still trying to formulate a plan. Ronpip turns his Tool of War into a Javelin to get himself around the island. Vimack rages and tries to get his own lightning to strike himself, but it instead targets a beetle that flies too close. Ronpip javelins himself to his brother, which lands at Vimack's feet, and arrives at his feet. Ronpip tries to push Vimack to get him to reach Dorizoul but causes them both to teleport, VImack a little farther than himsef, causing Vimack to teleport passed Dorizoul. Vimack tells Dorizoul to go with Ronpip, as Ronpip within touch. Ronpip turns his Tool of War into a Lance and reaches out to Vimack. Vimack takes the lance, and Ronpip pulls. Vimack teleports 10ft behind Ronpip.
Meanwhile, Leeland is beginning to get concerned at how long Vimack and Ronpip have been out on the island. Antilean is hesitant to leave the ship considering the effects of the island. He fires a crossbow bolt at a nearby tree, and nails it perfectly where he intends to, surprised that the bolt did not teleport. The rope goes slack, and Antilean begins to pull the rope in a hurry. Ronpip ties the rope to himself and teleports himself back towards the boat to untangle the rope. He lets Antilean and Leeland know they are okay but working out some problems. He makes his way back to Vimack and Dorizoul. With some complex planning and maneuvering and utility Tool of War useage, the group manages to get the three together, and Ronpip and Vimack are met with futility in their plans and Ronpip calls out to Antilean to "reel them in". Vimack does not want to go because that means leaving Dorizoul behind in his eyes, but Antilean pulls anyways. He initially fails dramatically, not being able to pull anything, but then he injects himself with Bull's Strength, buffing out temporarily and yanking Vimack to the ground as he teleports forward, and Antilean momentarily falls. Antilean continues to pull and Vimack anchors himself down not wanting to go. After some brotherly arguing, they all simply move and teleport back to the boat, and leave as soon as possible.
They reach the next island, and find a rocky outcropping at the center with a tunnel. Antilean volunteers to hop off the boat first and enter the island's vicinity. He lands in the sand, and nothing happens. Ronpip joins him as Antilean asks what kind of magic might be surrounding the place. Ronpip uses Detect Magic and detects Conjuration magic, which unerves Antilean. Vimack tells Dorizoul to sit and protect the boat before joining his comrades. They walk into the island and enter the tunnel. Lorellai seems excited to adventure into the tunnel, until they reach an corner. Ronpip prepares himself, and around the corner, he spots a Vulture, a Sea Hawk, a Bear, and a bipedal lizard, who are all wearing armor. Ronpip reports back that its strange company. Lorellai wants to see and goes around the corner, everyone else draws weapons. Upon seeing the party, the bipedal lizard responds with its name and a series of titles, and the party recognizes them, sort of. Ronpip laughs and points out the idiots got polymorphed, which then makes the bear stand on two legs and begin to frustratedly lecture him. They have a small conversation with each other's situations, and the bipedal lizard provides the party with a little inspirational praise from Bahamut, and the two part. The party exits the tunnel, only to find themselves on a similar island, with Magnanimous' Boat still ashore with Leeland, who is looking extra perturbed. Leeland vocalizes his disappointment with not having found these blue flowers he was sent for, and the party mirrors these feelings.
They pass by several other islands with their own various quirks. One in particular has an actual inhabitant, who is out hammering a sign that says NO ENTER on it. A minute passes by as they watch him and approach, and the sign disappears, as does the man. And a moment later, it repeats. The party thinks of ways to help, but he tells them he's tried most of them and all have failed, and for them to go out to save themselves.
They keep scouring islands in pockets of of the obscuring mist, and eventually reach a treeless island that has a ancient ruins that are surrounded by a unique blue patch of flowers. There appears to be four pillars of lapis lazuli, with a depression between them implying an entrance. Ronpip surprisingly does not detect the same radical magics that the previous islands had. Lorellai is excited and hyping herself up as this appears to be the place she needed to be. Leeland is also expressing excitement because those appear to be the flowers he was looking for.
Vimack expresses deep concern and nervousness, and takes careful steps, expressing the safety that comes with the steps that show nothing happening. Ronpip shares they must destroy EVERYTHING on the island to ensure it is safe, which triggers Leeland. But Ronpip admits he is fucking with him, and runs off on to the island. Vimack is perturbed. Not wanting to lose track of Leeland while they explore, they ask Magnanimous to keep an eye on Leeland.
The party approaches the pillars of blue stone, and water from the lake lifts and collides over them to form a large fish like being. She gestures aggressively for the party to stop. The Party are on edge, but take no action. She tells them to answer her riddle, or be banished. Temporarily. She says:
I am soft to touch, yet I cleave through the earth I move with the winds, and can rip you from your feet But if I remain still, I can fill you with mirth. What am I?
The party correctly guesses that the answer is: Water. The guardian nods and the door opens, leading deeper into the island. Lorellai speaks Aquan to the guardian, and then follows the party within.
Inside the area, the party completes several water themed puzzles, such as a deep pool of water requiring a person to swim below a normally infeasible depth and drain the water to reveal the next entrance, a series of orbs that perform tricks based on the phases of water, and a watery gate that is passible only when blood slows the mechanisms down.
At the end of the path through this dungeon-like area, the party finds themselves in a sanctum like area. Shimmering windows between pillars that hold the domed ceiling up look into the Plane of Water, a vast ocean of alien creatures and enormous corals and endless schools of fish. At the center of of the chamber is a sapphic crystal embedded into a geode of blue stone that sits upon a fountain. Lorellai walks to the fountain and reaches out for the crystal. Vimack stops her, and asks how she knows its okay to do this. Lorellai responds with confidence that it will be okay, and touches the crystal.
From below, two leviathan sized water elementals rise like water spouts from below. One seems warm, semi-green and soft in features, while the other is a cold cyan with crystals of ice sharpening its aggressive features. Lorellai turns to the party and confesses that she has not been truthful to the party. She confesses she was raised in the Plane of Water, and did not want "The First Tear" to fall into the wrong hands, and defied her mother and father to ensure it was given to worthy heroes. Her parents being the two water elementals before her.
The two elementals demand a trial to find if the party is worthy, and test the party's integrity, bravery, and will with waves of rushing water, ice, sleet, snow, and other trials by water. The party does everything in their power to maintain their control and safety with each other, and take notice that the two elementals do not actually attack the party. As such, the party does not attack the two elementals, though Antilean made a pre-emptive shot in fear. When the party gathers around each other as each wave bashes against the party, he asks Lorellai to apologize to her father on his behalf.
The party succeeds in their team work, and are offered "The First Tear", a special magic item associated with the Plane of Water. Lorellai unfortunately mentions that she cannot continue to travel with them, and must return home. The party is reluctant, but give her hugs and parting words while she returns with her elemental parents back to her home world. The arty leaves, and returns the surface. Antilean is taken aback by the small venture, as it was never his intention to become an adventurer. Meanwhile, Leeland has collected many blue flowers off the island. Magnanimous has been napping for a majority of the time. The party carefully returns to the boat to not disturb Magnanimous, and take off. Oddly, the mist parts for them, creating a path through to return them back to the docks of Phocellis.
On shore, the party parts with Magnanimous by giving him a net full of knocked out fish via Ronpip's Eldritch Blast. Leeland and Antilean put palms to their faces. Leeland wishes to return home, but the party decides they will escort him back, but after they complete a bit of business endeavours for Antilean, and tell him to stay at a local inn until then.
Which the party completes in Session 19...
item.dc:creator: K. B., Gunther

item.title: Session 19
item.description:
After Session 18:
Ronpip Thimble-bimble, Vimack Badger, and Antilean Faraday have acquired what they were told to be a Facet of Virtue, a water based crystalline magic object named "The First Tear". They've returned to the city of Phocellis, tell Leeland to go to his preferred pub, and continue a certain personal business for Antilean.
The party return to Blackwood Company, where Antilean is sees tht his wagon is secure and untouched during the whole venture. Sure his stuff is secure, he heads towards his business associated he once used. He takes the party to a dank, and dark area of the city, specifically a dredged alleyway. He eventually takes the party to a door that seems well cleaned but only from the middle down, and a sign above that says "Haggle's Goods". Antilean recalls that he can get some very volatile magically enchanted bullet rounds from this vendor, something he does not dabble in this himself. Ronpip can smell something familiar, which puts him on edge. The party enters the store, which seems mostly filled with common adventuring gear. In the back, Haggle seems to be working on a timepiece. When Antilean calls out to him, he comes to the counter and shows he has no legs to his body. Antilean tries to commission him for more bullets, but he has unfortunately ran out of the necessary resources. He sent adventurers to a particular location nearby where the crystals he needs grows naturally, but these adventurers have not returned since the weeks ago that he sent them. Ronpip recognizes that these crystals are very powerful and very volatile. Antilean agrees with Haggle to find the crystals, and potentially the adventurers he sent. Haggle provides them a local map and marks the area where they can find where they grow. The party buys a few mundane items that they believe will help them in their immediate and potential adventures.
The party set out, gathering their horses and Antilean's wagon. However, as soon as they step out of the gates, Antilean recognizes the Tabaxi caravan he used to travel with have decided to camp just outside the town. Antilean is accosted by a mix of emotions, which Vimack reads incorrectly and immediately draws his blades in preparation for something. Antilean calms him and tells him the Tabaxi are good people and there is no need for violence against them. Antilean calls out to them in his trademark greeting, and they all respond back, happily. One particularly older Tabaxi approaches and calls Antilean by his clan given name. Antilean recognizes him as the chief of this caravan of Tabaxi troop, Owl-in-the-Morning of the Gellicals. They make some small talk together, revealing their conflicting life philosophies between Antilean and his people. Antilean mentions that him and the party are out on a quest, being awkward about the whole interaction. Vimack points this out but Owl-in-the-Morning declares that Antilean was always awkward. Antilean asks about his ex-wife Serran and kids, and Owl-in-the-Morning mentions Reedsong is well, and the kids are with Daisy, which vexes Antilean and causes Vimack to get defensive for Antilean's sake. Vimack demands to know why Serran left Antilean, though Antilean would rather speak on the topic another time and move on with the quest they said they would fulfill. However, Vimack asks Owl-in-the-Morning where she is, and Owl-in-the-Morning, none-the-wiser, points out her location. Vimack then proceeds to find her, despite Antilean's vocal volume quickly reaching its limit in attempts to use words to stop the Goliath on a horse. Owl-in-the-Morning tries to stop him from taking the horse into the camp but his passive words are made far too late. Antilean and Ronpip hop off their respective mounts and chase after Vimack.
Vimack gallops through the caravan upon his horse, following Owl-in-the-Morning's directions. Eventually he finds a white haired, green eyed Norwegian Forest cat of a Tabaxi, whom he can assume is the Serran that was once Antilean's ex-wife. Vimack surprises her as he arrives, hops off his horse, and aggressively approaches her. He asks if her name is Sarren, which she responds that its not a name she has heard in a long time. She seems to reach for something behind her before she spots Antilean and stops, disappointed. Vimack confirms its her, and then asks why she left Antilean.
Antilean is so exasperated by the immediate events that he jumps on to Vimack in a desperate attempt to pull him away and save face. Ronpip also hops on to Antilean, to add a little gnome to the chaos. Antilean manages to get onto Vimack's back, but the Goliath goes nowhere. Ronpip grabs Antilean by his waist, and Vimack ends up swinging both of them around in confusion. Vimack puts his concentration back on to Serran and tries to convince her that Antilean is a good Tabaxi worth being with. Antilean pleads with Vimack to stop and apologizes to Serran. Vimack claims that Serran broke Antilean heart, but Serran retorts saying that Antilean was the one who broke people's hearts. Leaving the troop, her, and their kids for his business which has clearly offended her in some way. Antilean, at this point, surrenders his soul to the gods, slumped upon the floor in defeat knowing this could have been avoided and he would not have to have these words carve a second time into his heart. Ronpip hops off Antilean, sypathetic to the situation. Vimack pulls Antilean to his feet and claims he left out a few details, but Antilean counters that he was not given a chance to explain anything and that he had originally offered a private conversation. Before Antilean can ask about the kids, Serran mentions they are with Daisy, which they both know means Antilean will not be seeing them. She also returns to him some of his belongings he had left behind, though she subtly makes it apparent that he does not really deserve the courtesy. She returns a clan pancho and an amulet.
Vimack apologizes for his sudden appearance and interrogation, though Serran says that other Tabaxi do the same so its no big deal. Antilean stumbles upon his words about the future between him and her, and then says its good to see her again before awkwardly shuffling away. Ronpip shuffles after Antilean; Vimack says his goodbye as well and Serran asks Vimack to keep Antilean alive, at least for the kids sake. Vimack agrees, and the two part.
Antilean, sulking at the experience, bumps into a larger Tabaxi. He turns around and gives him a angry look that clearly shows he thinks he is above Antilean. Antilean recognises him as Billygoat-on-the-Hill, who is on the line as next to be chief of the caravan. Billygoat-on-the-Hill tells Antilean that he is not welcome. Antilean retorts that all Tabaxi are welcome, no matter the walk of life, but Billygoat-on-the-Hill counters that it will not be that way when he is chief.
Ronpip chimes in asking when thats going to happen, startling both Antilean and Billygoat-on-the-Hill, who jump at the sudden words from a creature with a deep voice that is smaller than they. Billygoat-on-the-Hill recompiles himself and tells Antilean to take himself and his compatriots out of the caravan before storming off. Vimack arrives at the latter end of the conversation, and asks Antilean if Billygoat-on-the-Hill is someone they need to worry about, but Antilean says he is just "a flat-foot with some big dreams" and nothing to worry about.
The party returns to their horses, Owl-in-the-Morning stroking Matilda's main and keeping her engaged while the party was away. Antilean regreets Owl-in-the-Morning and prepares to leave telling him to stay in good health. Owl-in-the-Morning is weirded out by this phrase, and asks what he means. Antilean relays that he met Billygoat-on-the-Hill. Owl-in-the-Morning agrees that Billy the Kid is disliked among many. The party departs the caravan and heads West.
Following the map that Haggle provided, the party comes upon some very old ruins of green and white stone with themes of eyes throughout. A statue of an unknown deity sits at center of these ruins, unidentifiable. Behind him, entry deeper into the ruins, where a single dead body lies upon the ground in a position that suggests he was exiting the ruins from below. Vimack scouts the area while Antilean and Ronpip check out the dead body. The dead body appears to be a human from Amun-Ra with a cloth mask across his face. Antilean inspects the body and sees several lacerations across the body, a few broken ribs, parts of his clothes burned, and, the most apparent problem, his entire back caved in like he was crushed by something. Ronpip begins to check the man's pockets for anything of valuable, information or by coin. They find a gold pouch hat has 12 gold pieces in it, and based on his positioning, he had something in an outstretched hand but it was taken away. Antilean looks about for tracks, and he spots seven sets of foot tracks. Six of them went in, one appears to have exited from the ruins. Vimack calculates that these tracks are a couple weeks in age, two of them seem like they are uniquely fresh headed inside.
Ronpip looks into the ruins, and sees a pit of black, porous rocks sprawled across the floor, and two bodies that are charred beyond recognition lying upon it. He summons the Tool of War and casts Detect Magic around the immediate area, but no magic is detected. He begins to investigate the doorway for traps, and does not find any immediate traps. He steps into the pit of black, porous rock, which clacks about as his steps kick up a few. He proceeds forward and checks the corridor ahead for traps, but also finds nothing. Ronpip knows that this area is trapped, but does not know what yet triggers it. Vimack takes notice the bodies are facing towards the exit like they were trying to leave, and thinks the trigger for these traps are further in. Antilean is confused as to why a dungeon would be made backwards and Vimack chimes in that its not meant to keep people out but keep people in. Antilean is disgusted by this suggestion.
Further in, slits with holes cover the walls, and splatters of dried blood decorate the walls and floor. The party tries to look around for what may set off the trap behind them and the traps within the walls, but nothing in the room suggests a trigger to these traps. A set of double doors lead into the next room, which Ronpip pushes open, feeling that the doors close themselves with weight. A Stairwell with the same slits and holes along the walls present themselves passed the doors. Vimack notices that the door handles are not fully closed, and something could slot into them. He places a pot between the doors to prop them open, and prevent them from being fully closed. In the next room, there is a room with pipe holes outfitting the walls and ceiling, and the floor dips downwards. Two bodies lie at the bottom, dead, grasping at their throats with some dried foam, ooze, and blood. Ronpip examines them, and easily determines that they died from a choking poison. Vimack tries the next set of doors and find they are also weighted to self-close. Antilean is nervous and preps his mechanical cannon that follows him wherever he goes. Ronpip summons his blade as they step up to the sides of the door, unsure what's on the other side. After his friends position themselves for combat, Vimack kicks in the door. The doors swing open suddenly, and then swing back shut of their own accord.
What Vimack could witness in this short moment was a a pillared room, swathes of rainbow coloured crystals along the edges of the room, an idol at the center of the room that is crying water onto a gemmed orb, and two robed figures that were standing at the idol, who make a startled glance back. Vimack relays his findings to the party. Ronpip knocks on the door but nothing happens. Vimack gently and nicely opens the door, and the two robed figures have disappeared.
Vimack moves in first, cautious of the two figures that have suddenly disappeared but cannot see them at all. Antilean follows inside with his turret Dragoon, standing next to Vimack back to back. Ronpip activates his Boots of Speed and positions himself between Antilean and Vimack to cast Detect Magic to look out for magic. He spots two vague auras of Illusion, and points them out to the party while also taunting the two figures hidden behind the magic. Ronpip then spots that one rushes at Vimack. Seemingly out of nowhere, Green Flames strike against Vimack as he is slashed, the Green Flames leap out at Antilean as well. A second slash swipes across Vimack, and he attempts to retaliate, but feels nothing strike against his blades. Ronpip sees the other one rush at Vimack, and though the figure's first attack caught Vimack's armor, the second attack seemed to adjust and swipe into Vimack's flesh, and a sonic field envelopes him. Neither figure reappears after making the attacks.
Vimack takes notice that Dorizoul has been tracking the figures, and curiously orders her to use her breathe weapon. The missiles swarm around the party before pummelling into the invisible figures, audible sounds of pain can be heard. Vimack makes a reckless attack in the direction of the sound.
Critical Hit! Despite not being able to see his target, Vimack manages to recklessly strike against the hidden assailant, slashing across the figures eyes; though he cannot see that he blinded him, he has confidence he did so with the attack.
Antilean realizes they are magically invisible and its not going away despite their attacks against Vimack, pulls out a flare gun, and fires it above them, dispersing the harmless cyan flames of Fairy Fire across them and the individuals, outlining them and ruining their invisibility. Antilean commands Dragoon to maneuvers about and fire at one of the now revealed figures.
Critical Hit! Dragoon fires with such surprising force, the figure gets thrown to the ground.
Antilean repositions himself for a better firing position. Ronpip casts Mirror Image on himself, and performs a disarming attack against the figure that is still standing. He strikes with a perfected maneuvers that along side his damage, he causes the revealed high elf drop his long sword, and he strikes with a follow up attack. He then zips passed him, with the figure swipes with claws and strikes a clone instead of Ronpip. As the party takes notice of their assailants and plans their next move, they notice the cut across the blinded assailant begins to close on its own, faster than what would be normal. The high elf that was prone rises, and tells his companion to make his blade sing, and he causes his blade to begin to vibrate. The blind one attacks Vimack with his claws, missing both of his attacks. The one that had his sword disarmed summons a blade of shadow, that hums unsettlingly. He takes swipes at Ronpip with this shadowed sword, one hitting a duplicate spawned from Mirror Image, and another going directly at Ronpip, who parries it to reduce the damage he takes. Vimack makes a reckless attack towards the blinded high elf,
Critical Hit! One strike reaches directly into the blinded high elf, and Vimack uses it to pull him in and get a more direct hit straight into his wrist with his ice enchanted blade, disarming him from his longsword.
Dorizoul rushes the elves, barrelling through them, but they do not get tripped up by the attack. Vimack accumulated enough electricity in him, and strikes the blinded elf with lightning. Vimack leaves the blinded elves threatening space, but the blinded elf catches him with his claws and grapples Vimack in place. Antilean whips Big Iron towards the blinded elf grappling Vimack, and strikes him across the back as Vimack is spinning around to try and get him off of him. Dragoon meanwhile fires at the other elf, but the elf deflects the blast of force.
Critical Hit! Ronpip sunders the shadow blade from the other high elf, and shatters the shadow magic blade and slices through the sword hand.
Ronpip then follows up with a low slash, slicing deeply into the sundered elf's leg. Ronpip leaves the space, and the elf takes a swipe with his last remaining claw. He ends up striking the last duplicate. Ronpip passes by the grappling, blinded elf but he is busy grappling elf. The elf summons a shadowed blade in his damaged hand, and begins to stab into Vimack while holding on to the grapple. The blade drives itself into Vimack's body, not cutting through it but Vimack can still feel the pain as though being stabbed.
Not knowing what left to do, the regeneration heals the sundered elf's hand and leg and he grabs at the orb sitting in the palms of the statue crying upon it in the center of the pillared room. Immediately as he grabs the orb, he calls out to his companion that they need to escape as this fight is not in their favour. He misty steps beside Vimack and makes two final attacks on him. Vimack attempts to break free from the grapple, but the elf maintains his oddly high strength, and the lightning charge from Vimack's rage only grazes him.
Antilean, witnessing his new found friend getting surrounded and beaten, draws his gun but is hesitant to hit Vimack in the chaos between the elves. A whisper on the wind catches his fur and ears.
"... promising hero... call my name... say the name..."
He reaches over to the amulet, feeling a sense of power coming from it. And he calls out, "Thunder. Thunder! THUNDER!! RAAAAAHHHH!!!"
He raises the pendant to the air, and a red lightning strikes him from the ceiling, seemingly through the earth above. His eyes glow with an empowered cyan blue, and with a heroically powered confidence, aims his Big Iron with precision. He fires three shots, tacticool reloads the final bullet, and fires a fourth time. The sundered elf attack Vimack takes one in the shoulder, causing him to spin into the bullet aimed for his head. The elf on Vimack's back takes the last two, the bullets coming within a hair's breadth from Vimack's neck on either side, one to the shoulder and one to the head as it reals back. Both, struck by immense damage, erupt into mist. Big Iron's barrel is red hot and smoking, and Antilean comes back to lucidity. Vimack hears a clang hitting the ground, as the orb drops to the ground. Ronpip quickly runs over an places the orb back into the statue's hand before it can do anything.
Antilean asks what just happened, and Ronpip and Vimack ask him back. Ronpip takes notice that the mist of the elves seep through the door crack. Antilean is still twitch from the events that he personally went through and has to catch his breathe. Vimack investigates the orb, which seems to match the same eye symbology throughout. Vimack looks into the orb's eye-like shape, and feels like he can be inspired with possibility. Ronpip states that if the elves wanted it, they should not have it. Vimack wants to get the crystals before they deal with the orb. He calls out to Antilean to begin work, but Ronpip wants to make sure things are safe first. Ronpip wants to dig around the crystals and not break them down, to save their legs.
Antilean requests an hour as he takes out a small suitcase of tinkering tools, and develops a quickset mason's tools to assist them in breaking out the floor beneath the growing magic crystals they wish to collect. The party begins to get to work, Antilean working the stone on the floor, Vimack takes the largest clusters to the wagon above ground, and Ronpip brings up the smaller clusters. At one point, Antilean strikes the root of a cluster of crystals and freezes, and Ronpip has a moment of Anxiety. However, luckily, nothing happens.
The party manages to collect all clusters of magic crystals together, and set it up upon Antilean's wagon, either within or tied down on top, carefully. Ronpip wants to check once again that they want the orb, and Vimack confirms they do. He tells Antilean to get a slow head start while he waits for Ronpip to return, and they will catch up with their horses. Ronpip returns to the orb of the statue. He has to take a moment to think about what he is about to do; then grabs the orb and casts Dimension Door to return to the surface. Once on the surface, he makes some distance and casts Shatter upon the entrance of the ruins. Ronpip says they need to get out of here, and they take off to catch up to Antilean. They discuss the events as they unfolded to each other, trying to figure out what just happened to Antilean.
The party returns to Phocellis, and take the crystals directly to Haggle. They shove the orb into the Bag of Holding and proceed to bring the crystal clusters into the backroom of Haggle's Goods. The party receives 1200 gold pieces for the quantity of the crystals he was given, extremely happy with what he had received. Antilean inquires about the wild magic bullets, and helping out making them to cover a time crunch. Haggle is hesitant at first, but allows it. The two begin to get to work, carefully grinding down the crystals into crafting size and creating the bullets. At some point, Antilean causes a flare of magic and Confusion spawns on to him, requiring Haggle to snap him out of it before he causes more problems. Thankfully, this is the worst that happens, and the two manage to create twelve Wild Magic Bullets.
While Antilean is busy, Vimack and Ronpip take a gaze into the Orb. Ronpip tries to infer what it does or is, but he cannot recall anything related to the gods of the modern age, but potentially one much much older and forgotten, potentially related to Evan's encounter. Vimack returns into the store and asks if he can buy five pitons, and Haggle provides. He also asks for a pot, specifically of the iron variety, but Haggle does not have one. Ronpip asks for oil, chalk, and flour. Haggle provides the oil and chalk, but he does not have flour. Ronpip inquires about potential explosives, and Haggle says he has Alchemist's Fire, a volatile, throwable substance in a bottle that self ignites once it is exposed to the air. Ronpip purchases one bottle.
The party finishes things up and returns to the inn that Leeland is staying at, the Whaling Ale. The party takes a long rest at the inn with rooms provided by Leeland, and Vimack, in the middle of the night, decides to visit Leeland's room. He sneaks to the room in the dark very quietly. Leeland is seen in the bed, rolls over and asks what he is doing, and he delivers a single gold piece in recompense before slinking off back to bed.
The party heads back to the capital with Leeland in hand, and no problematic encounters. They can see that the outer town has been evacuated and militia has moved in to set up defenses. They are stopped by guards initially, asking for their purpose for entering the city, and Vimack proudly exclaims they are friends to the Emperor Evan Escence. At first the guards are questioning, but Leeland's appearance reassures them they speak the truth. The party takes notice that the capital's militia is setting up several anti-siege structures. Wood elves and Tree Ents are also preparing as part of the vanguard to the defense. Ronpip is skeptical about the wood elven warriors, but the wood elves that came to the defense seem to have the confidence of trained, veteran warriors. Leeland is perturbed by the chaos. Leeland rushes off to deliver the flowers to his mother, and the party follows. Antilean meets Paul McCoy for the first time, and Leeland departs the party.
They head up from the Essence Estate to the Pillars of Archons to try and find Emperor Evan Escence, at the escort of Paul . Upon getting there, Evan spots the party, wearing regal attire but donning armor against his will, Duan insisting it is for protection. He produces wings and takes off towards the party within the throne room. Vimack spills the story to Evan, and Ronpip quickly tells him to keep it down. Evan flies to Duan and asks private chamber. Evan leads them to a private chamber, and Vimack continues to spill the story of recent events, recounting the events in Phocellis and introducing Antilean. Antilean decides to demonstrate his dexterity with his invention, the gun, and shows off the handling of the tool. Vimack and Ronpip finish recounting the events, how Lorellai left the group and returned home, and how they ventured into a backwards dungeon and fought against some high elves, again. They present the Orb to Evan, and although he does not recognize it directly, he does feel it has a connection to the kind of beings that Fidchelle the Aspect of Lore was. He summons My Immortal, and begins to cast Identify. She tells him that it is an ancien artifact in creation of Innis the Aspect of Ambition, and that the orb is the Solitaire of Inspiration. Vimack brings up that that the elves tried to take it, but they managed to stop them, although they were not able to kill them. Based on the tales of the party, his own knowledge of cryptid things of mystery, and the recent reports of increased creatures of the night haunting the nearby countryside, Evan does not believe that the party killed the elves that they encountered. Evan is concerned that they may be dealing with more undead high elves, or ones that continued the practice of Necromancy. Evan wants the party to provide the information to Duan Ping, as recent scout reports have either been scarce, or dead.
Evan recounts the reinforcements that came from the Summerset Forest to help with the defense. General Orthorion has came to the aid, revealing to Evan that he is an Arcane Archer. Legions of highly skilled archers, blademen, spearmen, Ursin Warriors, and Tree Ents have arrived from the elven reinforcements. And Evan and Duan Ping have scrambled together the militia of the capital, and several mages to remain at the backend defense.
